loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Ana Maria  es la recien electa presidenta D. la Alcom “ Las Hormiguitas” conformada por siete  socios cada uno dedicado a diferentes rubros D. actividades economicas. Ana Maria actualmente administra una pequena fuente D. soda; en donD. venD. bebidas., helados y golosinas. Ana Maria nos comenta que el negocio era D. sus suegros pero se lo entregaron para ayudar a su familia. Actualmente le va muy bien por lo cual desea ampliarlo y llegara  convertirlo en una bodega completa. El credito obtenido sera invertido en la compra D. diferentes marcas D. bebidas gaseosas y golosinas para diversificar su stock. Ana Maria desea ahorrar para construir un cuarto mas granD. en la casa D. sus suegros y asi vivir mas comodamente  con sus dos hijos menores y su conviviente.
Ana Maria esta agradecida y juntos a sus socios emprenden este sistema responsablemente.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is the recently elected president of the “Las Hormiguitas” (The Ants) Communal Bank.  The bank is comprised of seven members, and each one of them in engaged in different economic activities.

Ana Maria currently runs a small soda fountain where she sells drinks, ice cream, and sweets.  Ana Maria tells us that the business was her mother and father-in-laws, but they gave it to her to help her family.   It is currently going very well, and that is why she wants to expand it and convert it into a complete grocery store. 

The loan will be used to buy different brands of soft drinks and sweets in order to diversify her stock.  Ana Maria wishes to save in order to build a larger room in her mother and father-in-law’s house.  That way she will live more comfortably with her two minor children and her life partner.  Ana Maria is grateful, and together with the other members she responsibly undertakes this arrangement.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and sweets for her store.

loans.name: Los Triunfadores Del Rimac Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal “Los Triunfadores del Rimac” tiene 10 integrantes. Gladys es una D. ellos tiene dos hijos y actualmente esta separada. D. forma  ambulatoria venD. empanadas y productos D. chocolateria que ella misma prepara, tiene el apoyo D. sus hijos que actualmente ya realizan trabajos D. practicas profesionales, adicionalmente da en alquiler algunas habitaciones D. sus casa para estudiantes universitaR. ya que su vivienda es aledana a una universidad muy concurrida por jovenes provenientes del centro del pais. 
Para facilitarse y lograr producir sus productos que ofrece en venta Gladys invertira el credito en la compra D. un procesador D.  alimentos.  La Alcancia Comunal “ Los Triunfadores del Rimac” es una D. las primeras del programa en la zona y siempre estan demostrando su afan por salir adelante con sus familias, ellos estan agradecidos por el apoyo a sus negocios. En la fotografia se presentan a todas las socias incluso con sus hijos menores, el unico ausente por motivo D. trabajo fue el socio cesar.
texts.en:
The “Los Triunfadores del Rimac” community bank has ten members.  Gladys is one of these members.  She has two children and is currently separated.  She sells empanadas and hot chocolate that she prepares herself as an itinerant street vendor.  Gladys has the support of her children who are currently working as interns.  In addition, she also rents out some rooms in her home to university students since her home is near a university that is very popular with young people from the center of the country.

In order to make her work producing the products that she sells easier, Gladys will invest her loan money in buying a food processor.  The 'Los Triunfadores del Rimac' community bank is one of the first in the program in this area and its members are always demonstrating their desire to get their families ahead in life.  They are grateful for the support they are receiving for their businesses.

In the photo, all the members of the bank are present, including some of their children.  The only member who was absent, for work reasons, was Cesar.

loans.use: to buy a food processor

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Maritza participa en la  Alcancia Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe” que esta conformada por 9 socios. Maritza es casada y tiene tres hijos en edad academica. Actualmente tiene una bodega en donD. venD. diversos productos D. primera necesidad, su bodega se llama “ Keyli”. Maritza nos cuenta que trabajaba en un hospital como emfermera  pues posee estudios profesionales pero la distancia y la edad D. sus ninos le impidieron seguir con ese empleo y a raiz D. esta situacion se inicio en el negocio en casa. Adicionalmente ofrece servicios D. aplicación D. ampollas, inyectables esporadicamente.
Maritza pertenece a La Alcancia Comunal “ Virgen D. Guadalupe” esta participando  recurrentemente en el programa y D. forma puntual cumple con sus compromisos, todos los socios estan contentos con el apoyo a sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen D. Guadalupe" which is maD. up of 9 members.  Maritza is married and has three school age children.  She currently has a general store where she sell basic need products.  Her store is called "Keyli".  Maritza used to work in a hospital as a nurse, she has completed the education for that profession, the distance to work and her small children have prevented her from continuing with that work. This situation gave rise to her starting her business in her home.  She also sporadically provides services of injecting medications.

Maritza and her husband have acquired a car and wish to proviD. an advanced education for their children, for which she works hard every day.  Maritza will invest her loan in the purchase of tubers such as potatoes, onions, cabbage and various spices, garlic, chili peppers for sale in her store.

The Communal Bank  "Virgen D. Guadalupe" has participated in the loan program several times and punctually complies with the terms.  All the members are happy with the support they get for their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions and spices, garlic and chili peppers for resale.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is 45 years old and married to Siddeeq who is a 48-year-old mechanic. Taghreed had a lot of free time and wanted to be a productive person in society, but because she was not able to finish school, she was limited in the things she could do.  Taghreed decided to put her skills and hobby into something useful, which is sewing and tailoring. Five years ago, she bought a sewing machine and started tailoring clothes and selling them. Then people came to her asking her to make things other than clothes such as bed covers, special bags for fruits etc. Being able and flexible to serve her customers’ needs has given her an additional point to attract more customers. Today she has applied for a loan to buy more equipment (machines) so she can serve her customers on time and open her own sewing workshop in the future, as she is now working at home. Since Taghreed is a conservative person, her sister Jameeleh agreed to pose in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Nilda  es integrante de la nueva Alcancia Comunal “ Luz de la Esperanza” que esta conformada por 7 vecinos  de la zona denominada La ronda en Chosica. Se formo gracias a la nueva esperanza que crecio en ellos al recibir el mensaje de lograr adquirir un capital de trabajo y fomentar el habito del ahorro en el programa de Alcancias Comunales de Edaprospo. Nilda junto a su esposo han logrado adquirir una casa en la capital, pues ellos provienen de la sierra de Lima. Su esposo se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ella a la comercializacion de queso en diferentes mercados de la ciudad. En ocasiones y estacionalmente vende frutas y tambien cocina para terceros. El reciente prestamo sera invertido en materiales de construccion como: cemento y arena para su casa. Nilda desea comprar un auto propio para trasladarse y comercializar sus productos.
 La Alcancia Comunal “ Luz de la Esperanza” recibe este prestamo para mejorar sus condiciones como micro empresarios y estan comprometidos a responder puntualmente cada mes.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the “Luz de la Esperanza” (Light of Hope) communal bank which is made up of seven neighbors from an area called La Ronda in Chosica.  It came together thanks to the new hope that grew in them when they received the message that they had acquired working capital and would be able to start to encourage the habit of saving in Edaprospo’s communal bank program.

Nilda and her husband have managed to acquire a house in the capital because they come from the mountains in Lima.  Her husband raises cattle and she sells cheese in the city’s various markets.  Occasionally and seasonally she also sells fruit and cooks for third persons.  The current loan will be used to buy building materials like cement and sand for her house.  Nilda wants to buy a car of her own to get around in to sell her products.

The “Luz de la Esperanza” communal bank received this loan to improve their conditions as micro entrepreneurs and they are committed to make their monthly installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: La Alcancia Comunal “ La Union Hace la Fuerza” se inaguro recientemente y la electa presidenta es Liana quien es madre soltera con un hijo, a sus 31 anos de edad se dedica  al negocio de alquiler de cabinas para tener acceso al internet, ademas realiza diversos trabajos de tipeos para escolares en general desde hace siete anos. Liana desea ahorrar para casos de emergencia en su familia y nos manifiesta que su anhelo es  ampliar su negocio a un bazar librería. El prestamo sera invertido en la compra de algunos articulos como: papeleria, lapices y adornos para regalos. Liana junto a sus vecinos que la invitaron a participar del programa Prosperidad de Edaprospo desean adquirir un capital que les ayude cada vez en lograr adquirir ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "La Union Hace la Fuerza" was formed recently, and they elected Liana as president of the group.  She is a 31 year-old single mother of one who has an internet cafe business.  She has also been doing various types of typing work for schools for 7 years.  Liana wants to save up an emergency fund for her family, and she tells us that she also wants to expand her business into a stationery shop.  She will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of some items, including: stationery, pencils and gift wrap.  Liana and her group members, the neighbors who invited her to join the Prosperity Program from EDAPROSPO, want to acquire capital that will help them each day to generate income for the well-being of their families.

loans.use: to buy stationery, pencils and gift wrap

loans.name: Maram

texts.en: Maram is a young woman from Tulkarem city. Maram is one of FATEN's borrowers. She took several loans that helped her and her husband start a vegetable and fruits store. Maram took out a loan from FATEN, in addition to the savings she could manage with her husband, to buy the small piece of land that is next to her house to start planting the seasonal vegetables she sells in the store. This will decrease the cost and bring her better returns. Maram is photographed in FATEN's office with her son.

loans.use: to purchase a small piece of land to plant vegetables

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en: Khetam is a young woman from Tulkarem who is married. She has two daughters and three sons. Khetam is one of FATEN's committed borrowers. She received two loans and repaid them completely on time. Khetam took out a loan from FATEN as she could and her husband save and build their own house, Khetam needs $2,500 to install house accessories such as windows, doors and painting. Khetam's husband appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to finish her house that was built recently

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for plastering and painting her home

loans.name: Najea

texts.en:
For reasons of modesty, Najea's son is pictured in the photo. Najea has lived all of her 60 years in Negev. She is the mother of 15 and runs a women's clothing stall in the main market of her town. She sells a wide variety of women's apparel from everyday wear to elegant holiday & party dresses. Najea has had this stall for several years and continues to expand and earn a decent income. After steady growth, increased business management experience, and retail success, Najea has decided to move from her stall into an actual shop in the souk-city market. This way she will be able to expand her stock, have an organized and friendly location but still be located where her clientele is and knows of her.

Najea needed this loan to expand her stock of women's clothing and apparel and complete her expansion before the annual pilgrimage season to Mecca, where high demand exists for her products.

Najea wants to expand her business and establish a successful shop that is open seven days a week for women throughout the region. She wants to continue to help her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for more women's clothing and apparel to sell

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en:
Watfa is a 36-year-old mother of nine from southern Israel. She lives and works in the Negev. Watfa opened a household, kitchen supplies, gifts and trinkets store. She has gained clientele not only from her village but also from the surrounding area. Watfa's draw is the variety and size of her stock as well as her low prices. She has found a niche for many shoppers and has return customers throughout the year.

The wedding season is coming soon. In order to benefit from this retail opportunity, Watfa needed this loan to increase her stock and purchase additional gifts, mattresses, sheets and other household items for sale.

Watfa wants to expand her business even further and in the future, she wants to include some high-end quality pieces to appeal to an additional customer base. For her family, she wants peace and happiness and to continue and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase gifts, mattresses, sheets and other household items to sell

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 60-yea- old widow from the Negev. Siham scraped by with welfare for many years until she decided to open a business activity from her home and nearby area. She started by selling treats, sweets and toys from her house and near the local elementary schools during breaks and at the end of the school day. A couple of years ago, she began selling these trinkets and clothes in an area near the city market. Gradually she has expanded her business and focused on clothing and in-demand items. Siham has seen her business provide a steady income and grow gradually over the last couple of years. She has grown out of her current location and is ready to move to a stall in the nearby souk, an open-air market.

Siham needed this loan to expand her business, move into a stall at the city market and for additional stock. This will ensure her a larger clientele and steadier income.

Siham wants to continue to manage her business. She hopes to begin saving steadily to ensure a safety net for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mahdeyya

texts.en:
Mahdeyya is a 55-year-old housewife and mother of five daughters and five sons. Mahdeyya's oldest son has a poultry farm in the city of Tulkarm and another son works in construction. The one who works in construction needed new construction tools and kit. Mahdeyya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the kit her son needs, which will allow him to have more construction contracts.
Mahdeyya appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and kit for her son

loans.name: Aziz Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Aziz Fatima is married and mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. All of them are studying in different classes. Her husband operates a clothes-selling business. He purchases clothes from Lahore and Faisalabad which are famous for their textile industry and he then sells to different cloth shops on profit. He offers his clients a good variety of clothes, that’s why he earns good profits.  

Aziz also sells clothes along with her husband. Her client base is neighboring women.  Aziz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy clothes in bulk quantity and of different sorts which will help him offer more variety to his clients and earn better profits.   
 
Aziz is confident that after investment her husband’s business will grow further and make him more income. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Aziz is very confident about her husband’s business growth.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.   

Note; In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Aziz Fatima.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a working lady who operates a clothes-selling business from her home. She sells clothes to her community clients at a profit. Her husband also sells clothes. His clients includes different clothes shop owners who purchase clothes from him at a good rate. 

Safia is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is a graduate and does a job in a private organization while the others are studying. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband ‘s clothes-selling business. He will use the loan money in purchasing clothes in bulk which will allow him to offer more variety to his clients for greater profits. 

Safia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has established a good credit behavior in the previous loan year and never missed any meeting. She is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for her husband.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Safia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is married with seven children: four of them work and two study in school. Her eldest daughter who is 20 years old stays at home and helps Kosar in her routine tasks. Her husband is a vegetable vendor and sells vegetables by putting them on cart and visiting different streets of the city. 

Kosar herself is a housewife and a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful in her work. She does this business to supplement the income for her family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some fresh seasonal vegetables to sell. Kosar is hopeful that by investing loan money in her husband’s business, her husband will be able to make good profits and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is married with two sons. Both of them are very young and studying, attending local school. She herself is illiterate but she never compromised on her children's education. She works very hard for that purpose. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her community clients.  She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. 

Her husband has a business selling costume jewelry. He is very experienced in his business and has a good number of clients who purchase jewelry from him regularly due to his good rates and good designs. Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some costume jewelry like necklaces, earrings, etc. for the expansion of his business.  

He has been operating this business for the past 12 years and Kalsoom is hopeful that he will be able to fulfill the demand of his customers and improve his income after investing the loan into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat operates a sewing business at her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to share the financial burden with her family. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. She is also a very good housewife and manages her household responsibilities very well. 

Her husband operates a grocery store in the community. In the store, he sells different grocery items such as cooking oil, spices, sugar, etc. to his clients. His rates are cheap, that’s why he makes good profits. 

Farhat has given birth to three daughters: two of them are studying as well as running a tuition center at their home. Her youngest daughter in only a few months old.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to put more groceries in his grocery store to improve his business. He has been operating this business for the past 5 years and Farhat is confident that an investment will bring good profits to him.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is a very caring person by nature. She stays at home and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. Her husband is a loader by profession and uses a donkey cart for his business. With his cart, he loads goods and delivers them to the designated places. He is very active and performs his tasks very well. Tahira has given birth to two children. Her eldest son is in kindergarten and the youngest one is only two years old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a donkey because his current donkey is old and he cannot bear heavy loads. By purchasing a young, healthy donkey, her husband will be able to work better and earn more income. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Tahira is hopeful that a loan will help him improve his business and increase his income. She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Tahira.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey

loans.name: Osman Sillah

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Osman. He is married, and has two children, aged 4 and 8 years. He has three additional dependents who live with him because they help him with his business while he supports them to go to school.  

In 2007, Osman established his phone, phone accessories, CDs and DVD plates business. He began his business to help provide a livelihood for his family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 850,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Osman has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy mobile accessories and DVD plates in a larger quantity for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Osman plans to supply institutions and extend his business to some villages around Makeni city, buy a motor bike for transportation and educate his children to the college level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more assorted phone accessories and DVD plates in a larger quantity.

loans.name: María Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Cumpliditas, vive en el cantón Girón que es visitado por sus cascadas, su naturaleza y su rica gastronomía, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña María tiene 72 años, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos son  casados e independientes, comparte los gastos con su hijo soltero. Con su sacrificio y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de alimentos desde hace 55 años, vende todo tipo de granos secos como frejol, lenteja, garbanzo, habas, etc. labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de granos secos.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora. María is a member of the Las Cumpliditas (Little Bouquets) communal bank. She lives in the Girón canton, which is visited because of its waterfalls, natural beauty, and tasty cuisine. Her people maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 72 years old. She is a widow with 4 grown children. Three of her children are married and independent. She shares household expenses with her unmarried son. As a result of sacrifice and hard work she has succeeded in building her own house.

Señora. María has been engaged in the sale of food for 55 years. She sells all types of dry grains, such as beans, lentils, garbanzos, faba beans, etc. She works seven days a week without a set schedule. She has her own stall in a market in the city.

This is the second loan she has had in the communal bank, and her loan will be invested in the purchase of dried grains. Her goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried grains such as beans, faba beans, garbanzos, lentils, etc.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Cumpliditas, vive por el sector de San Joaquín, este sector es conocido por la producción de hortalizas y verduras, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, tiene varios lugares para deleitar su rica gastronomía.
 
Doña María tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 23, 21 y 19 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo es casado e independiente y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de hortalizas hace varios años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito  y lo va a invertir en la compra de hortalizas para crecer en el negocio.

Su sueño  es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the Las Cumpliditas (Little Bouquets) communal bank. She lives in the San Joaquín sector. This sector is known for the production of garden produce and vegetables. Her people maintain their culture and traditions. San Joaquín has several places which provide delight with tasty cuisine.

Doña María is 45 years old and married. She has 4 children, ages 25, 23, 21, and 19. Her eldest daughter works and helps with expenses. Her eldest son is married and independent, and her two youngest children study at a high school in the city. Her husband works as a construction worker. Working together, they have built their own house.

For several years, Señora. María has sold vegetables. She has her own stall at a market in the city and works seven days a week without a fixed schedule. At home, she raises chickens and guinea pigs for her family’s consumption and for sale.

This is the second loan she has had in the communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of vegetables so that she can increase her business. Her dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Jessica Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Jessica es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, por sus tradiciones y por la cultura de su gente, quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas muy amables y calidas.
 
La Señora. Jessica tiene 23 años, es casada y está en el sexto  mes de embarazo. Su esposo trabaja y estudia en una universidad de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres con quienes comparten los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Jessica trabaja en una veterinaria y está estudiando la misma carrera esperando ser una gran profesional.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir para iniciar con un criadero de codornices.

Su meta es tener su propio local de Veterinaria.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the communal bank “Corazón de Maria” (Mary’s Heart) and lives in the Valle parish.  This parish is known for its beautiful landscapes, for its traditions, and for its people’s culture who work in business, raising animals, and agriculture.  They are warm and friendly people.

Jessica is 23-years-old, married, and is six months pregnant.  Her husband works and studies in a university in the city.  They do not have their own house as they live in her parent’s house and share expenses with them.

Jessica works with a veterinarian and is studying this career hoping to be an important professional.

This is her fourth loan and she will invest it in starting a place to raise quail.

Her goal is to have her own veterinary clinic.

loans.use: to put in a place to raise quail.

loans.name: Blanca Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, por sus tradiciones y por su cultura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas muy amables y calidas.
 
Doña Blanca tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 20, 19 y 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su tercera hija trabaja y se paga los estudios de la universidad, su cuarto hijo ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en su propia unidad de taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Blanca vende productos Avon hace 2 años, vende sus productos de domingo a domingo. También realiza manualidades como: aretes, binchas, manillas etc. esta labor la realiza hace 10 años, aprendió estas manualidades por habilidad propia y sus productos los realiza bajo pedido.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 4 años, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus manualidades.
 
Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank “Corazón de María” (Mary’s Heart) and lives in the Valle parish.  This parish is known for the beauty of its landscapes, for its traditions, and for its culture.  Its people work in business, raising animals, and agriculture.  They are very warm and friendly people.

Blanca is 42-years-old married, and has five children of 23, 22, 20, 19, and 16 years of age.  Her two oldest children work and help her economically, her third daughter works and pays for her studies in the university, her fourth son helps with household chores, and her youngest son studies in a school in the city.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and works in his own taxi.  They do not have their own house, they live as renters.

Blanca has sold Avon products for the last two years.  She sells her products every day.  She also makes crafts like: earrings, headbands, bracelets, etc.  She has done this work since she was 10-years-od.  She learned these crafts studying them herself and makes her crafts to fill orders.

She has been in the communal bank for four years.  The loan will be invested in materials to make her crafts.

Her goal is to buy herself a house.

loans.use: to buy materials for making crafts.

loans.name: Verónica Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita Verónica es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive por el sector de Lazareto en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es cuna de deportistas y escritores, su gente es amable y cordial.

La Señorita Verónica tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres que es propia, su mamá es comerciante de ropa y su papá es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi.

Nuestra socia al igual que su mamá es comerciante de ropa usada, tiene un puesto en un mercado de la ciudad, laboran solo 2 días a la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, el resto de la semana trabaja en su casa prestando los servicios de lavado de ropa.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. El dinero de su crédito lo va invertir en la compra de ropa usada.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of the communal bank “Corazón de María” (Mary’s Heart) and lives in the Lazarete area of the city of Cuenca which is the third most important city in the country: the cradle of sports stars and writers.  Its people are cordial and friendly.

Verónica is 24-years-old, single, and lives in her parent’s home that they own.  Her mother is a clothing seller and her father is a taxi driver.

Our member sells used clothing like her mother.  She has a stall in a city market.  They work only two days a week from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon.  The rest of the week they work in their house offering a laundry service.

This is the first loan she will do with the communal bank which she was invited to by her mother.  She will invest the money from her loan in buying used clothing.

Her goal is to grow her business more.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en  el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, cuna de grandes atletas y escritores, cuenta con una variada gastronomía, su gente es calida y amable.

La Señora Blanca tiene de 24 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad privado, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

Doña  Blanca vende cocinas industriales, este es negocio de su papá, trabaja allí de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. También ejerce su profesión, ella es estilista y realiza sus trabajos en su casa a sus clientes.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de belleza como tintes de cabello, permanentes, champú, etc. para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un local para poner un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is a member of the communal bank Las Morlaquitas [The Debutantes]. She lives in downtown Cuenca, a city which was named a [UNESCO] World Heritage Site in 1999, birthplace of great athletes and writers, home to a diverse gastronomy and of warm and kindly people. 

Señora Blanca, 24, lives in a committed relationship and has a two-year-old son. Her husband is a private security guard. They do not have their own home but rather rent. 

Doña  Blanca sells industrial stoves which is her father's business. She works there Monday to Friday, from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. She also practices her profession, which is that of stylist, in the homes of her clients. 

The communal bank is in its third loan cycle and she will invest her loan in the purchase of beauty products, such as hair dyes, permanents, shampoo, etc., in order to continue on with her business. 

Her goal is to open up a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes, permanents, shampoo and other beauty products.

loans.name: Martha Andreina

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, cuna de grandes atletas y escritores, cuenta con una variada gastronomía, su gente es calida y amable.

Doña Martha tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Martha se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa también cría pollos, se dedica a esta actividad hace 6 años y las ventas las realiza en su casa.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga que es socia activa. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para continuar con este negocio.

Su meta es comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the communal bank “Las Morlaquitas.”  She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, a city that was named a World Heritage Site in 1999, cradle of great athleates and writers, and which has a varied cuisine and warm and friendly people.

Martha is 40-years-old and lives in a common law marriage and has three children of six, five, and two years of age.  Her oldest daughter studies in a small school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not have their own home as they live as renters.

Martha works doing the household chores, caring for her children, and raising chickens at her house.  She has worked at this for six years and she sells out of her house.

This is her second loan with the communal bank, which she was invited to by an active member.  She will invest the loan money in buying chickens to continue with this business.

Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en por el sector de Sinincay en de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, cuna de grandes atletas y escritores, cuenta con una variada gastronomía, su gente es calida y amable.

Doña María tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. 

La Señora. María  tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 9 años en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche y en el mismo local se dedica a la venta de comida.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito los mismos que le han beneficiado para su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad e ingredientes para preparar sus platos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener una sucursal de su tienda.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Las Morlaquitas” (Sly Little Vixens) communal bank.  She lives around Cuenca’s Sinincay sector.  Cuenca was designated a Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 1999.  It is the birthplace of great athletes and writers and has a varied cuisine; its residents are gracious and kind.

María is 37 years old, married and has three children who are 15, 10 and 7 years of age.  Her eldest daughter is in high school and the other two children go to the local school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  With their joint work as a couple they’ve managed to build their house.

María has had a grocery store for nine years.  She sells basic need items and is open Sunday to Sunday from 7am until 10pm.  She sells prepared food in the same space.

She’s in her third loan with the communal bank; they have been beneficial for her business.  She will use the new loan to buy basic need items and the ingredients to prepare her dishes to continue growing in her business.  Her goal is to have branch of her store.

loans.use: to buy basic need items and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda  is from the village of Baki, Aurora Zamboanga del sur. She is 63 years old, married, and has 7 grown children. To make a living, Erminda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to  purchase additional seeds to plant. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Erminda’s fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia  is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling balut in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Cynthia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional eggs for sale. This will be Cynthia’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs for sale.

loans.name: Lyndamar

texts.en:
Lyndamar is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lyndamar owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lyndamar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional grocery items for sale. This will be Lyndamar’s second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small business entrepreneurs.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and has 2 grown children. To make a living, Elfa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Elfa’s second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 23 years old and married with one infant-aged child. He is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 6,000 per month. 

Kennedy is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farm. Kennedy has been growing corn for almost three years.

In the future, Kennedy hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income to support the needs of his family. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist him in the business so that he can start another kind of business and give his family a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farm

loans.name: Teody

texts.en:
Teody is from the village of Magsaysay, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Teody is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Teody owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor  transport services. Teody has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Teody joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teody is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teody from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Adeela's Group

texts.en:
Adeela is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month which earns her reasonably good income. She is also a very responsible housewife and does her household work very well. 

Her husband is a fruit seller by trade. He sells fresh seasonal fruit from his shop in the community market. Adeela is the mother of four children: two of them are enrolled in a local school while the others stay at home. 

The summer season has come and her husband needs to offer some fresh seasonal fruit to his customers. Therefore, Adeela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in this regard. Her husband has more than 10 years of experience in his business and Adeela hopes that an investment will help him improve his business and increase his profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Adeela.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for resale.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida is a seamstress by trade. She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. Due to the good quality of her work, she receives regular orders from her customers. She has 9 children. Her two elder daughters work and the other two are enrolled in a local school to get an education while the others stay at home. Rashida couldn’t provide education to all of her children due to financial constraints. 

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to improve his business. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Rashida hopes that an investment will help him improve his business which will result in better financial conditions for her family. 

Rashida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for resale.

loans.name: Merlinde

texts.en:
Merlinde is 52 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Merlinde has a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 10 years. Merlinde has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.   In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 41-year-old mother who has three school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for almost 15 years. 

Analiza is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm. Analiza hopes that this loan will be a great help to make their corn plantation productive. Currently, Analiza earns PHP 7,000 each month in this field of work.

In the future, Analiza hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn income to support the education of their children and to satisfy their daily basic needs. She believes that someday, she can open a general store with the continuous assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 56 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Matilde has a home products sales business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years.  Matilde has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase plasticware and home products to sell.   In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy plasticware and home products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending. 

Rosalie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari(variety) store.  She has successfully repaid 1 previous loan from NWTF before this loan.   Rosalie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: stock groceries for her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en:
Maylin is now 26 years old and married with no children yet. Maylin is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 6,000 per month. 

Maylin is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional breeding pigs and pig feed. Maylin has been operating a hog-raising business for almost four years.

In the future, Maylin hopes to improve their piggery by raising more pigs in order to help her husband earn income for the sake of their future and to satisfy their daily basic needs. She believes that through their patience and strong determination, they can improve their source of income together with their status of living. They are thankful for the financial assistance of the Kiva lenders who help them in their business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Gulsagyira's Group

texts.en: Gulsagyira is the leader of this group. She is 62 and married to a pensioner. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and a daughter. Both children are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money for the family budget, Gulsagyira cultivates strawberries and her husband breeds cattle. The family’s monthly profit is 4,000 soms. With money received from the loan, the family plans to purchase a bull-calf for breeding; for this purpose, Gulsagyira applied for the loan. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land in order to increase the area for growing strawberries. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.en: Muazzam is married and has five children, all of them grown up. She is from Khujand, Tajikistan, where she runs her own business selling groceries in a store next to her house. One of the advantages of her small venture is the lack of competition in the neighborhood. Muazzam has a degree in commerce and has been working in the sphere of food manufacture and sale for about 12 years. She is also very energetic and motivated. She always moves forward actively to reach new goals and make her business more lucrative. Muazzam is very creative and knows how to financially manage her enterprise. Currently, she is requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to purchase food items from wholesalers to then sell in her store. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is now 46 years old and married with four school-aged children. Alice is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 8,000 per month. 

Alice is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. Alice grows rice on their farm and has been doing it for almost 20 years.

In the future, Alice hopes to have a large production of rice in order to earn income to finance the education of her children. She believes that if there is patience and hard work, she can achieve her goals and give her children a better future. She is so thankful with the Kiva lenders who offer financial assistance to entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she is bringing up two daughters. Both children study at school. 

Eleven years ago, Mahabat’s husband saved 5,000 KGS and purchased cattle. Since that moment the family has been breeding cattle. With money received from the loan, Mahabat wants to purchase a calf for breeding.  

In the future, she wishes  to provide a good education for her daughters. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 40 years old and has given birth to three children. Her eldest son has a job while the others are studying, attending a local school. Her husband is a "loader" by trade and uses his horse cart to deliver goods to designated places. 

Jamila is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her tasks very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a new cart because his current cart has become old and needs a replacement. By purchasing a new cart, he will be able to provide better services to his clients and earn more profits. 

Jamila hopes that the loan will be beneficial for her husband and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jamila.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for transport business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John Mwaniki, aged 51, is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for ten years. His mixed farm produces milk and chickens which are all sold locally. He employs one farmhand. He also earns income from his general shop in the same location. 

John has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after he successfully repaid his second loan of Kes 50,000. He has requested for this loan of 70,000Kes to construct a dairy unit and expand his poultry farm by increasing the stock of his chickens and purchasing chicken feeds. The extra proceeds from this loan will enable him to educate his 5 children and improve the livelihood of his family.

He faces the challenge of high cost of animal feeds which affects his production. However, he plans to improve his farming by acquiring quality bred of dairy cows. He appreciates Juhudi's efforts to boost small scale farmers.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is 34 years old and has given birth to four sons.  Her eldest son is a motor mechanic while the 2nd one is a tailor. The other two stay at home. Shamim could not educate them because of meager financial resources. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to passengers and earns income for the family. 

Shamim is very supportive lady by nature. She knows that alone her husband is unable to meet the financial requirements of his family that’s why she helps him by selling clothes. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. She makes the utmost effort for providing comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk and of different varieties which helps her to fulfill the orders of her clients and earn good profits.   She is expecting that after the loan investment her business will improve and her family’s income will increase, and that will help them have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда жительница района Шахритус. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. В основном она занимается продажей детской одежды. В этой области уже три года. Муж и дочка помогают ей в продвижении ее бизнеса. Она хочет увеличить товарооборот и расширить свою деятельность. Кредит берет для покупки ковров и детской одежды.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in Shahrituz. She is 39 years old, married, and has one child. She works trading in the area’s central market. Primarily she sells children's clothes. She has been doing this for three years. Her husband and her daughter help her with her business. She wants to increase sales and expand into other areas. She is taking out a loan to buy carpets and children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy carpets and children's clothes.

loans.name: Gerishom

texts.en:
Gerishom is aged 37 and married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 12. Two of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 15 years now and employs two farmhands. His mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested for this loan of 62,400 Kes to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to improve his family's livelihood and pay school fees for his children. He plans to acquire at least ten dairy cows in future with a target of 100 liters of milk daily.

His major challenges have been animal diseases and shortage of animal feed during the dry season. He also faces the challenge of transportation and lack of stable market for his milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt), in Hovd province of Mongolia. His older two children go to a local secondary school while the youngest one is in kindergarten. He operates a animal raw hides trading business with the help of his wife. He started his business at a rented stall at a local market in 2005 and gained much experience. He is a polite man who is planning to continue his business in the future. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal raw hides in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more animal rawhides

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a mixed farm in the town of Kitale in western Kenya that produces beans, maize, vegetables and milk. She employs one farmhand and sells her products locally.

Mary is 37 years old and married with 6 children who all attend school.

She has requested for this loan of 80,000 Kes to expand her poultry farm by increasing the stock of her chickens and purchase poultry feeds. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood and pay school fees for her children. Her major challenges have been lack of enough animal feeds, diseases and poor prices for her products. She hopes to expand her farming activities in future by venturing into sheep farming as well.

loans.use: To puchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 41 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Emelyn is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land where they grow rice and corn crops. Emelyn also raises pigs to sell. She plans to use her loan to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed. Emelyn works hard to improve her businesses and earnings.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a single mother with one child who is still young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills. 

For the past 2 years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Nancy faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming self reliant in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase food stock, including sacks of beans, bundles of maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu because their requirements are favorable.

loans.use: to purchase food stock, beans, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 26 and 21. Her husband works as a farmer.

Beverly is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land where they grow rice crops. According to Beverly, they currently earn about 2,800 PHP per month from farming. Beverly works hard to improve this income. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Cesario

texts.en:
Cesario is 49 years old and is a married man with 4 children. The oldest child is 19 years old. 

Cesario is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice to sell. He earns about 4,000 PHP per month from doing this farming.

This loan will be used by Cesario to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. In the future, he hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her older daughter, aged 21, goes to a college while the younger one, aged 15, is in secondary school. Her husband is the governor of a Bag: the smallest administrative unit in rural areas of Mongolia. She manages a hair salon in her town. She started her business after graduating from her training in 2001. Since then she has managed to stabilize her business and build a strong customer base. She is a friendly woman who says, "With the loan I want to have my own workshop and new equipment". She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase some salon equipment

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 51-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 26 and 24. She and her husband are both farmers. She helps till their land where they grow rice crops. According to Gloria, she has been engaged in farming for 20 years. She earns about 4,000 PHP per month from farming. Gloria also raises pigs in her backyard.

Gloria's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feed. In the future, she hopes to have her own capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is a farmer and tills her own land. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Herminia earns about 5,000 PHP from farming. She works hard and finds ways to improve her business and income. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Enhnaran

texts.en:
Enhnaran is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Dornod province, Mongolia. They live in a house made from a container, which was previously used to contain, store and transport products. Enhnaran's husband is a guard and her two sons go to a local secondary school.
Enhnaran manages a vegetable trading business in her town. She started her business with working capital of 60,000 MNT in 1995. Back then she used to sell a small amount of candies and biscuits. As her business grew she broadened her selection of products and began selling many kinds of vegetables such as carrots, potatoes and cabbage. In 2000 she received a loan from Kiva partner, XacBank, to use in the expansion of her business. She is planning to continue her business and to build a house with the earnings. She is an open-minded and hardworking lady who says, "I am planning to finish the construction work on my house and have my own store in the future." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Marufjoni

texts.ru: Маъруфчон проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 20 лет. Холост. Он проставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр, где он пополняет счет, продает мобильные телефоны, карты для пополнения счетов, зарядные устройства и панели телефонов. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения новых моделей мобильных телефонов и зарядных устройств.
texts.en: Marufjoni lives in Rudaki. He is 20 years old and single. He provides a service. He has a kiosk where people can add money to their cell phone debit accounts, and he sells mobile phones, cards with minutes, chargers, and phone cases. He has been doing this for two years. He is taking out a loan to buy new models of mobile phones and chargers.

loans.use: to buy new models of mobile phones and chargers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg is 34 years old and lives with her daughter and mother in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her daughter goes to a local secondary school and her mother helps with the family business. Enhtsetseg manages a grocery trading business, which she started in 2002. The store is located in her own property. In order to supplement her earnings, she has started to sell clothing as well as her groceries. Now Enhtsetseg is responsible for selling clothing and her mother is responsible for selling grocery items. Enhtsetseg is a polite woman who possesses great experience and knowledge. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more stylish and modern clothes for all ages for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more stylish and modern clothes for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 19 and the youngest is only 1 year old.

Evelyn is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She helps her husband grow rice and corn crops at their farm. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Evelyn sells their harvest and fattened pigs at her town's market. She said that through their farm and small piggery, her family's needs are met.

This loan will be used by Evelyn to purchase farm fertilizers, piglets and feed. She hopes for her businesses to improve in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is married with seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son sells garments as well as runs a juice stand. The second one has a welding shop, while the 3rd one is an electrician by trade. Her remaining children are getting their education from a local school. Her husband has a business doing furniture polishing. He is well known for his work and people come to him for services.
 
Robina supports her family financially by selling artificial flowers. She operates her business from her home and supplies flowers to different flower shops to earn income. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s juice stall. With the loan, he will buy a juice extracting machine that will help him provide good quality juice to his customers and increase his profits.  He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Robina hopes that an investment will bring better profits to him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: To buy a juice extracting machine for juice stall.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur is 30 years old and lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

She conducts a clothing trading business in her town. She started her business in 2009 and gained much experience. Before her current business, she sold fruits at a local market for four years. With her earning she managed to buy a truck in order to start a transportation business with the help of her younger brother. She also had a chance to move her business indoors in order to have heating in winter time. 

She is a polite woman who says, "I am planning to expand my business and have my own container in order to improve my business." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase some clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase some clothes

loans.name: Zebedee

texts.en:
Zebedee is 62 years old and married. He has six children aged between 17 and 35. His youngest child is still attending school.

Zebedee has been practicing mixed farming for the last 25 years in Kitale town in western Kenya. His mixed farm produces eggs, maize and beans, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his rental houses in the same location.

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES and has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to expand his poultry farm. 

This loan will enable him increase his stock of chickens and purchase enough poultry feed. He says that this loan will enable him expand his poultry farm and he will be able to get a steady income that will help improve his lifestyle. 

His biggest challenge has been the high death rates at the early stages of the chicks.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of perishability of products and seasonality in her business. Halima dreams of becoming self reliant and owning her  business premises in the future. 

She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning procedures. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and beans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are currently attending school.

John has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale in western Kenya for the last 37 years. His main products are maize, milk, pineapples and bananas, which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family.

John has requested a loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 52,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help in the education of his children and improve their living standards as well. 

He hopes to practice dairy farming in large scale in the next five years in order to cut costs and improve his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.
