Asia is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past 3 years, Asia has been operating a water selling business.  She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Asia faces a major challenge in the stiff competition from other water sellers in the area. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future. 

With this loan for Kshs 70,000, Asia wants to purchase a water pump and pipes to deliver water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and water pipes

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is from the village of Villa Felipa, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Romela is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Romela sells seafood products, including fish like sardines and milk fish, in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 6000, Romela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI.  That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Romela is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more fish like sardines & mackerel. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

location.town: Villa Felipa, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni  lives  in the city of Kampala in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her late sister’s children.    

Zaituni has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 9 years, and works 7 days out of every week.  Zaituni sells her products at the market by means of retail.   She also generates additional income by selling charcoal.

Zaituni has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more mangoes, pineapples, oranges, cabbages and onions. The main business challenges for Zaituni include transportation, thieves, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to start growing the fruits herself and to build her own house.  

Zaituni lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy fruit to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom go to school.   Mary sells sugar, beans and rice to earn income. She has borrowed a loan to stock more sugar, beans and rice to sell.  She hopes to construct a house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more sugar, beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old.  He is married and has three children. He has been a farmer for the last five years.  Patrick learned about KADET Ltd through advertisements done by KADET.   He has been a good client who repays his loan well.

Patrick has applied for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy farm supplies and animals.  This is his 3rd loan with KADET.  He plans to use the proceed from the loan to plough back into his farm.

Patrick is an honest man who can achieve and thrive if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his coffee shop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 28 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school.  Agnes sells sugar, soap, beans and rice to earn income.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more sugar, soap, beans and rice to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: Stock more sugar, soap, beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 33 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She runs a green grocery.  She also sells cereals and does small-scale poultry farming  for extra income.  Previously, she was employed at a supermarket.  

Through Faulu Kenya, Emma has been trained on business management.  This has helped her sustain her business for five years.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  Emma has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy more cereals.

loans.use: To buy more cereal grains to resell

loans.name: Hadhjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in the city  of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with six children, all of whom are in school.  Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding her family and school fees.   Hadjah has a business selling fruit and vegetables.  She has been in this business for over ten years and she works seven days a week.  Hadjah sells her products at the market.  She generates additional income through room rental.  

Hadjah requests a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO).  She will use the loan to buy boxes of mangoes, pineapples, oranges, cabbages and onions to sell.  Hadjah's main business challenges are thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to buy a plot of land where she can grow fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, potatoes, pineapples and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Hamze

texts.ar: حمزه عمره 39 سنة متزوج وهو اب لثلاث اولاد يعمل في يعمل في رسم الخرائط واجراء معاملات وورش بناء له في عمله 11 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره بشكل جيد حيث انه طموح يحب العمل ويريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد للعائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة لرسم الخرائط وللتعهدات البناء من تراب واحدار واسمنت وغيره هو انسان طموح محب للعمل ولكنه يتعرض للمنافسة في العمل وهو بحاجة الى تطوير عمله ولكن ما يميز عمله هو الانفراد في الرسم الخرائط وتخليص المعاملات في الدوائر الرسمية فهو محبوب ومميز في قريته ومقصود من اصحاب البنايات والورش والتعهدات ولكن لا تنقصه سوى بعض المادة لدعم نفسه من خلال دعم عمله
texts.en: Hamze is 39 years old and married with three children. He works in design/map drawing and construction, and he also conducts workshops. He has 11 years experience in this. He loves his business and wants to develop it as he is ambitious and wants to secure a good future for his family. With this loan he wants to purchase new map-drawing tools and construction materials such as stones and cement, etc. He is exposed to a lot of competition and is in need of developing his business. What distinguishes him is his design/map-drawing. He is well loved in his locA. area and is the sole service provider for many in the construction industry. The only thing he lacks are the finances necessary to support himself by supporting his business.

loans.use: to purchase new design/map-drawing tools and construction materials.

loans.name: Zulieta

texts.en:
Zulieta is 54 years old and from the village of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is widowed and has three adult children.  Zulieta owns and operates a specialized retail store.  Her main source of income comes from buying and selling litres of gasoline and oil in the local community. Zulieta has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Zulieta joined Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 12000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Zulieta is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.  This will be her fifth HSPFI loan.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI):

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Tirigot

texts.en:
Tirigot is 26 years old and married with two children. He has been a farmer for five years. He learned about KADET Ltd. through an advertisement by KADET staff.

Tirigot requests a loan of KES 40,000 that he will use to buy farm supplies.  This loan will be his third from Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  Tirigot plans to invest the proceeds from the loan back into his farm. He is an honest man who strives hard to achieve.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chemicals, wax and detergent to make soap.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 31 years old and married with one child.  He runs a barber shop and also runs a grocery for extra income.  Previously, he ran a cafeteria.  

Justus requests a 30,000 Kes loan to buy a shaving machine and renovate his business premises.  He has gained business knowledge from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya that has helped him sustain his business.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business and employ people.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine and renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah  lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).    Peninah has a business of tailoring.  She has been in this business for less than a year and she works 6 days out of every week. Peninah sells her products in a shop. 

Peninah has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials and thread. She also generates additional income through motorcycle for hire.  The main business challenge(s) for Peninah include seasonality and increasing prices of clothing materials.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school.   Peninah lives in a home that doesn't have access to electricity, but has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials and thread

loans.name: Getruda

texts.en:
Getruda has been practicing mixed farming in Kitale town in western Kenya for thirty years now. She sells her products of maize, beans and bananas to the local market. She mainly depends on the income from her farm for the basic needs of her family. Getruda is 54 years old and a widowed mother of 10 children, five of whom attend school.

She has made a third loan request from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kes to expand her poultry farm. She will use this loan to buy additional stock of chickens and chicken feed.  That will enable her to practice commercial poultry farming. She laments that poultry feeds are becoming extra expensive and unaffordable to her and this has been her major setback. She says that her intention is to expand her farm in the future and be the main supplier of poultry products to the local market.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farm.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 7children, one of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother, maid and grandchildren).    Aida has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Aida sells her products at the market.   

Aida has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through poultry farming and rental rooms.  The main business challenge(s) for Aida include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second-hand shoes.   Aida lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees..

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Saningo

texts.en:
Saningo is 24 years old, married, has been a farmer for the last eight years.  He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area.

This is his third loan and he plans to purchase farm supplies and livestock to fatten. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.  His dream is to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area.

 He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies and animals

loans.name: Asaad

texts.ar: اسعد عمره 24 سنة هو رجل غير متزوج يعمل في بيع وصيانة وتأجير اجهزة الكومبيوتر له في عمله 8 سنوات يحب العمل ويسعى دائما الى تطويره والاعتماد على نفسه في زيادة مدخول عمله وتطوير نفسه وخاصة انه يساعد اهله في تكملة احتياجاتهم فهو محب للعائلة يريد دائما ان يكون الروابط الاسرية بينه وبين اهله يريدم من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة ومعدات للصيانة للمحل له تاريخ جيد في مصلحته حيث انه استطاع ان يطور نفسه ولكن لا ينقصه سوى المادة حتى يقوم بدعم مصلحته وزيادة مدخوله وخاصة انه في طور بناء عائلة هو انسان طموح يتميز عن الآخرين بحبه لهذا العمل وخاصة لقلته في محيطه ولكن ما ينقصه هو المادة فقط يحلم بتوسيع عمله حتى يصبح مركز صيانة كبير يضم جميع انواع الكومبيوترات
texts.en: Asaad is 24 years old and unmarried. He works in the selling, maintenance and leasing of computers and has eight years experience in this. He loves his business and is constantly aspiring to improve it and independently increase his income and progress himself. He also helps towards his family's living costs as he loves them and wants to ensure that he maintains family ties. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock and maintenance equipment for  his store. His business has a good reputation but he lacks the finances necessary to support it and thereby increase his income as he is in the process of settling down with his own family. He is ambitious, and is distinguished from others by his love for his business. He dreams of expanding his it so that it can become a big maintenance and repair centre for all types of computers.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and maintenance equipment for his computer repair and leasing store.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 24-year-old man from Tulkarem. He works in a local development institution. Tareq is recently married and still working on furnishing his house. 
He took out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase a fridge and a washing machine as he was using old ones that he had borrowed from his parents.

loans.use: to buy home appliances (fridge and washing machine).

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is 32 years old and single.  He weaves baskets and carpets.  He has sustained his business for five years because of his artistic baskets and carpets.  He also runs a barber shop to supplement his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business.  He hopes to move his business to a spacious room so that he can train people on how to weave.  He wants 30,000 Kes to buy thread and a weaving machine.

loans.use: to buy thread and a weaving machine

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en: Khadra is a 58-year-old hardworking widow. She has five children and they live in a tent somewhere in Madaba. Khadra is known for her special kind of homemade bread called “shrak”. She has been baking and selling shrak for more than 20 years now. She also makes yogurt and a special Jordanian dried yogurt called “Jameed” using the the milk from her sheep. Now Khadra has applied for a loan to buy some machines, such as a mixer and other equipment, to facilitate the production of her bread and yogurt. She depends on these projects as a source of income to support her children.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, such as a mixer, for making bread and yogurt.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, six of whom are in school.  She has a business selling old clothes.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Alice sells her products at the market.   

Alice has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms   The main business challenge(s) for Alice include the rainy season and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own business premises and also to educate her children up to University.   Alice lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of  second-hand clothes

loans.name: Moseka

texts.en:
Moseka is 23-years old and single.  He supports his parents. He does mixed farming; i.e., raising livestock and growing wheat.  He has been doing this for the past two years. He learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member.

He paid his first loan successfully and applied for the second loan for supplies for farming and to purchase more sheep.

He hopes to make a profit and use the anticipated balance to expand his farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and more sheep.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu  lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).    Nulu has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Nulu sells her products at the market.   

Nulu has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.   The main business challenges for Nulu include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van, improve on her standard of living and also to educate her children up to university.   Nulu lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Alex also takes care of additional family members (her late sister’s child).    Alex has a business selling milk.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Alex sells her products at the market.    

Alex has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of milk.    The main business challenge(s) for Alex include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow so that she can get profits to buy milk cans.      Alex lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Basel

texts.ar: باسل عمره 38 سنة يعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه له في عمله 5 سنوات هو رجل متزوج واب لولد له تاريخ جيد في مصلحته حيث يتميز بالنظافة والبضاعة الجيدة يحب عمله ويريد ان يزيد من مدخول عائلته ومدخول مصلحته حيث يريد ان يتميز في عمله بالبضاعة النادرة وخاصة الموسمية منها فهو طموح ومحب للعمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة موسمية وزيادة رأس المال في العمل يتميز بأسعاره المميزة والجودة في العمل يريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد لأولاده ودعم عمله هو لديه رغبة كبيرة في امتلاك عمل خاص به وتكبير مصلحته ولكن ما ينقصه سوى المادة حتى يتمكن من تكبير العمل
texts.en: Basel is 38 years old and married with a son. He works in a grocery store selling fruit and vegetables and has been doing this for five years. His business has a good reputation and he is distinguished for his hygiene, good prices and high quality produce. He loves his business and wants to increase his income. He is ambitious and wants to provide rare and seasonal produce. He has a great desire to purchase his own store and expand his business but he lacks the financial capital necessary to do this. With this loan he wants to purchase seasonal produce, increase his financial capital to support his business and thereby secure a good future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal produce and increase the financial capital necessary to support and expand his business.

loans.name: Jectone

texts.en:
Jectone is 37 years old and single.  He does welding to earn a living.  He has been in the business for eleven years.  Apart from welding, he operates a motorbike transport business.  

Jectone hopes to pursue a bachelors degree in mechanical engineering in the future.  He also dreams of expanding his business so that he may employ more people.  He has requested 25,000 Kes to buy cables, metal bars and bulbs.

loans.use: to buy cables, metal bars and bulbs.

loans.name: Zenzele Group

texts.en:
Hawukelaphi is 57 years of age, and a widowed mother of 6 children aged 11 to 26. She runs a retail business in Nkandla, South Africa (KZN). In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

Hawukelaphi has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables at town shelters for 10 years. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is facing rainy and cold weather when she sells, because the shelter she usually sells in is an open shelter. She requested this loan from WDB and Kiva to buy more fruits and vegetables. She adds that the extra income from this loan will help her earn profits so she can grow and sustain her business. In the future she would like to build a house for her family.  She gives thanks to WDB and Kiva, and will be pleased if they can help her build a stable shelter to sell in.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Karangae

texts.en: Karangae is 25 years old, single, and supports his parents. He has been a mixed farmer for the last eleven years.  He learned about KADET LTD from KADET staff during their marketing campaign. This will be his third loan and he is planning to buy more sheep and farm inputs. His business has been doing well in the area due to conducive weather. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to boost his business.  His hope and dream is to become a prominent businessman in the livestock industry and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and farm inputs.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.ar: هادي عمره 29 ينة اعزب يعمل في تعهدات الحفلات وتأجير الصوتيات له في عمله 3 سنوات يحب عمله وهو كل اهتمامه يريد من خلال تكبير عمله الى توسيع المحل ودعم عمله وزيادة مدخوله يتيميز عمله بالدقة والابتكار يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة صوتيات واجهزة اضاءة حيث انه يتميز بالانفراد في العمل في هذا المجال ولكن ما نقصه هو رأس المال في هذا المجال حتى يتمكن من الاستمرار في العمل ما يعيق تقدمه في العمل هو زيادة رأس المال له زبائن من القرى المجاورة وابناء قريته لقلة هذا المجال في المحيط هو شاب طموح نشيط ويريد التطور والتقدم في العمل
texts.en: Hadi is 29 years old and unmarried. He works providing supplies for parties, and rents out audio equipment. He has been doing this for three years. He loves his job and it is his sole priority. He wants to expand his store and increase his income. His business is distinguished for its innovative nature. With this loan he wants to purchase new lighting and audio equipment. His business is unique but he lacks the financial support necessary in order to achieve continuity and stability. He has many customers from his local and surrounding areas. He is an ambitious and energetic young man who wants development and progress for his business.

loans.use: to purchase new audio and lighting equipment for his business.

loans.name: Kipino

texts.en:
Kipino is 27 years old, married, and blessed with three children.  He has been a farmer for the last five years.  His wife is a housewife.

Kipino learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dreams are to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Emma Maria

texts.es: Emma es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Inti, es casada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos. Emma se dedica a la venta D. caldos D.: cabeza, cordero, mondongo, pata, etc. D. lunes a domingo, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. todo tipos D. carme, maíz, verduras, etc. para la preparación D. caldos. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por la ayuda que les dan en los créditos y porque pueD. ahorrar, con sus ahorros hizo mejoras en su casa y negocio. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en: Emma is a member of the Musuq Inti community bank.  She is 46 years old, married, and has five children.  Emma's business is selling sheep's head, lamb, tripe and cow's feet soups, etc. from Monday to Sunday.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying all kinds of meat as well as corn, vegetables, etc. for preparing her soups.  She likes FINCA Peru because of the help that they give through their loans and because she is able to save and, with her savings, she has maD. improvements to her home and business.  Emma's dream is for her business to continue prospering.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of meat, corn, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Inti, tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos: 2 profesionales y 2 que están estudiando. Julia tiene una panadería. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. harina y demás ingredientes para la preparación D. panes. Está 2 años en FINCA Perú, ingresó por la invitación D. su hermana. Le gusta por la facilidad D. los préstamos se trabaja a base D. confianza y se pueD. ahorrar. Con sus ahorros y préstamos pudo comprarse algunas máquinas D. panadería. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus 2 hijos que están estudiando terminen su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank Musuq Inti. She is 49 years of age, married, and has four children: two professionals and two in school. Julia has a bakery. The loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of flour and other ingredients for the making of breads and pastries. 

She has been a client of FINCA Perú for two years, and joined at the invitation of her sister. She likes it because of the ease of acquiring a loan, because the work is based on trust, and it allows one to save. With her savings and loans she was able to purchase some bakery machinery. 

Her dream is that her business continue to grow, and that her two children who are in school would finish their professional educations.

loans.use: to purchase flour and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Katimama

texts.en: Katimama is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. He has been practicing mixed farming (including sheep rearing and wheat farming) for the past seven years.  He learned about KADET LTD through KADET staff. He repaid his first loan successfully and applied for his second loan of KES 30,000, which he plans to spend partly on his farming and partly on purchasing more sheep.  He hopes to use the anticipated profits from his loan to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farming.

loans.use: to improve his farming operation and to purchase more sheep

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is 35 years old and married with one child.   She makes and sells shoes and belts made of leather.  She has four years of experience in the business.  She runs her business with three employees.  She hopes to buy a piece of land in five years.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy leather.

loans.use: to buy leather

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 57 years old, married, and has seven children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years.  Peter learned about KADET LTD through a registered client.  He applied for his second loan of 36,000 KES with KADET, which he will use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to  make a profit and use the profits to purchase sheep for fattening.  His dream ise to become a well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom attend school.  Gloria has a business of knitting sweaters.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Gloria sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale/retail. Gloria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more threads and needles for making sweaters.  She also generates additional income through part-time teaching.

Gloria's main business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business expand so that she can hire employees to assist in knitting.  Gloria lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more threads and needles for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is married and has two children. For the past two years, Sera has operated a cafe business, cooking beans, rice, and flat breads. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Sera faces a major challenge of competition from other cafe operators in the area. Sera is requesting a loan for 35,000 KES, which she will use to purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cereals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. The family owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: To purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour. and cereals.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has two adult children. She is a market vendor from Melitopol. Yelena sells yarns and crocheting and knitting supplies, as well as household items, in the central marketplace of her hometown. She offers a nice variety of inventory and knows how to present it to customers. Yelena has been in this business for 15 years. She has 70,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas. 

Yelena is requesting a loan for 10,000 Grivnya, which she will use  to purchase diversified types of yarn for further sale in her vending kiosk. She believes a better selection of yarns of different colors and thickness will help her improve her sales and expand her trade. One of Yelena’s future plans is to open a new vending facility.

loans.use: to purchase additional yarns.

loans.name: Mirachisun Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mirachisun inicia su ciclo 24, con 14 socias. Las cuales tienen diversos negocios como la venta de comida, venta y preparacion de queso, venta de cebiche, ropa, cosméticos, conducción de mototaxi y otras son feriantes.
Iris, es la Presidente en éste ciclo, es casada y tiene 4 hijas de 33, 30, 25 y 15 años de edad, Iris se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y tambien vende prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa. Iris está en FINCA Perú desde el 2006, le gusta porque le facilitan dinero para trabajar y se puede ahorrar, con sus ahorros incrementó su capital de trabajo. Su sueños es poder abrir una tienda donde venda todo tipo de cosméticos y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
The “Mirachisun” communal bank is starting its 24th cycle with 14 members who have various businesses like: food sales, cheese making and selling, cebiche (marinated fish cocktail) sales, clothes, cosmetics, mototaxi building and others. They are merchants.

Iris is President in this cycle.  She’s married and has four daughters who are 33, 30, 25 and 15 years of age.  Iris sells cosmetics via catalogue and also clothes for women, men and children.  The loan she’s asking for will be used to buy merchandise for her clothes selling business.  

Iris has been in FINCA Perú since 2006.  She likes it because they provide her with money to work and one can save.  She used her savings to increase her working capital.  Her dream is being able to open a store where she can sell all kinds of cosmetics and clothes.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Eazat

texts.ar: عزات عمره 45 سنة هو رجل متزوج واب لاربع اولاد يعمل في بيع المواد الغذائية والسمانة له في عمله نحو 5 سنوات يحب العمل ويسعى الى تطويره وزيادة رأس المال فيه يرد ان يؤمن العيش الكريم له ولعائلته فهو طموح محب للعمل يعمل بجد ونشاط يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة ومواد غذائية للعمل ادوات تنظيف وغيره حتى يتمكن من توسيع العمل ليشمل عدد اكبر من البضائع وبذلك من الزبائن يحب ان يكون لديه محل اكبر وهذا من احد احلامه يتميز ببيع الالبان والاجبان وهذا ما يتميزه في محيطه العملي ويتميز بالنظافة والاسعار الجيدة ولكن ما يقف عائق دون تطور العمل هو رأس المال حتى يتمكن من عبور الاحوال الاقتصادية الضيقة بعض الشيء الى رأس مال جيد وبضاعة متنوعة
texts.en: Eazat is a 45 year old married father of four children. He works in a grocery store and has been doing this for approximately five years. He loves his work and is seeking to develop it as he is ambitious, energetic and hard-working. He wants to secure a decent standard of living for himself and his family. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock, groceries and cleaning materials, etc. for his store in order to be able to expand his business and accommodate more stock and thereby a greater number of customers. It is one of his dreams to own a bigger store. He is distinguished for selling different types of milk and cheese and also for his cleanliness and good prices. What is preventing his business from progressing is lack of financial capital in order to overcome a difficult economic period, and be able to achieve financial stability and sell a greater range of goods.

loans.use: to purchase new groceries and cleaning products to sell at his store as wells as to expand his business.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married and has one adult son. She is a private entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Nadezhda runs a retail sales business selling women’s robes and men’s footwear in a local marketplace called Krytyi (Covered). She has been in this business for 16 years. Currently, her gross income is 26,000 Grivnyas; her net profit is about 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 11,500 Grivnyas to purchase affordable clothing and footwear. She is planning to buy footwear made in Ukraine from Ukrainian wholesalers and resell it at a reasonable price to middle class customers. Nadezhda is very determined. She is willing to work hard and achieve success in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more affordable clothing and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire an excavator

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 29 years old and married, with one three year-old child who attends school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 8 years and employs two farmhands. He sells his produce of milk, maize and chickens at a local market. He depends on the income from his farm for the basic needs of his family.

Edwin has made a loan request of 30,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm by purchasing additional stock of chickens and chicken feed. The proceeds from this loan will enable him to build a decent house for his family and improve their living standard. He faces the challenge of poultry diseases, fluctuating market prices for farm produce, and lack of enough feed for his poultry and dairy cows. He hopes to have expanded his farming activities in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter.  Aba sells food items, such as smoked fish, garden eggs, salt, tomatoes, red pepper and other food items.  She has done this for 5 years. Her income is used to help support her family.  Aba will use the loan to purchase food items for resale.

loans.use: to purchase food items for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 31 years old, married and has a five year-old child. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. Additionally, he works as a marketer. He believes that with financial support from Faulu Kenya, he will grow his business and open other branches. He has requested for 20,000 Kes to relocate to a bigger business premise.

loans.use: To relocate to a bigger business premise for his retail shop

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Harriet has a business of selling spare parts, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Harriet hopes to build a house of her own.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to improve upon her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past 1 year, she has operated a video cafe business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a retail shop business which contributes to her other source of income. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season low numbers of customer turn up. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a television, videos and CDs for entertainment in her video cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a television, videos and CDs for her video cafe business

loans.name: Mary Eva

texts.en: Mary sells chemicals for pest control (shown on the second shelf) at Elmina near a village in Nkontrodo. She also sells dresses and cloths. She is single. Her loan will be used to buy additional chemicals and cloths for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more goods for her shop.

loans.use: to buy additional chemicals and cloths for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Margaret has a business of selling new clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margret sells her products at the market. Margaret has requested for a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of new clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Margaret   include rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own business premises and also to educate her children up to University. Margaret lives in a home that she owns she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for business premise.

loans.use: To buy more bales of new clothes

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws). Milly has a pub business. She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days each week. Milly sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Milly has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerry cans of local gin. She also generates additional income through selling onions and cabbages. The main business challenges for Milly include defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked bar. Milly lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells food stuffs such as cassava, plantains, onions, garlic, groundnut paste and others at Elmina near Nkontrodo. She is divorced and has two children. She has been selling food items for 12 years. She is responsible for the household. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 41 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos ellos son independientes; la socia se dedica a la administración de su heladería, la socia tiene en casa su fábrica de helados artesanales, ella tiene sus congeladoras, sus depósitos para preparar los helados, sus paleteras para los helados en formas de paletas; la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de azúcar, y otros insumos para la elaboración de helados artesanales; la socia produce helados de lúcuma, vainilla, chocolate, leche, fresa y otros sabores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la fábrica de helados. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba". She lives in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, married, and she has 3 children, all of whom are independent. She dedicates herself to managing her ice-cream shop. She has a production company of traditional icecreams in her home. She has freezers, tubs where to prepare her icecreams, popsicle molds to prepare her icecreams in popsicle form. She requires a loan to invest in the purchase of sugar and other ingredients she needs to make traditional icecreams. She makes icecreams in different flavors: lucuma fruit, vanilla, chocolate, milk, strawberry, and other flavors. She requests a loan to invest in her ice cream production business.

She values the loan granted to her and she is infinitely thankful because it will help her increase her business and improve the quality of her life. She is committed to making her payments at the determined schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyakimwa  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « Neema »,  âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont certains étudient et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Son mari est un cadre d’une entreprise publique douanière « l’Office Congolais de Contrôle (OCC) ». La cliente  est vendeuse  de boissons (Primus, Aigles, Fanta)sur avenue du fleuve dans le quartier Katindo.  Il ya 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, en 2005, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter  respectivement  10 casiers de Primus, 10 casiers Aigles et  5 casiers de Fanta.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison dans sa propre parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Neema» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The client, Kyakimwa, entrepreneur and leader of the business group Neema is 50 years old, married, and a mother of four, some of whom attend school and others who live on their own. Her husband is employed by the public customs company l’Office Congolais de Contrôle (OCC). The client sells drinks (Primus, Aigles, Fanta) on the river walk in the Katindo neighborhood. Nine years have gone by that she’s been doing this. Meanwhile, in 2005, she got her first loan from Hekima. This new loan will help her buy 10 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Aigles, and 5 cases of Fanta. In addition, she would like to pay for her children’s schooling and build a house on her own plot. The client thanks Hekima for its actions to help poor women who are excluded from classic banks. It is worth noting that the business group Neema is mostly female.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Aigles, and 5 cases of Fanta

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a peddler of used clothing. She sells the clothing at a village in Elmana Cape Coast Called Nkontrodo. She is divorced and has two children. 

Araba is responsible for the education, feeding and clothing of her children. Her loan will be used to purchase large amounts of used clothes for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells second-hand bedsheets and clothes at Elmina near Nkontrodo. Esi is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more secondhand clothes and bedsheets for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes and bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old, married and has five children. She runs a green grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for twenty years.  

Esther also sells second-hand clothes for extra income. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she had previously serviced three loans which she used to boost her business. She has requested for another loan of 20,000 Kes to buy kale, fruits and clothes.

loans.use: To buy kale, fruit and clothes

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is taking care of three children, together with her husband. Nana sells items such as gari,plantain and cassava at a village called Nkontrodo in Cape Coast, which she has done for some time now. Her income, generated from the sale of gari, is used to help her husband feed the family. Nana will use the loan to purchase more bags of gari to supply her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari to supply her customers.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is single. She cooks banku (corn dough and cassava dough cooked together). She serves the banku with hot pepper sauce, okra stew, and fried fish. Alongside the banku, she also sells provisions at Elmina, near Nkontrodo. Efua is going to use the loan to purchase corn, fish, okra and other items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, fish, okra and other items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Maame Araba

texts.en: Maame is a single parent taking care of two children. Maame sells slippers and cloth at Elmina near Nkontrodo in Cape Coast. Maame uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers and cloths for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Araba plans to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and cloths for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells cassava, plantain and sacks of maize at Elmina. She has two children. She has been in this trade for 8 years now. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy sacks of maize to distribute to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a store room for the maize.
Efua is squatting near some sacks of maize.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida lives in the Bwaise neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Aida has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years and works 7 days a week. Aida sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Aida has requested for a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Aida include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to educate her children through university. Aida lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Joyce has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days a week. Joyce sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Joyce has requested  for a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenges for Joyce include defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked shop. Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more  boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a driver. Adjoa sells clothes and sandles at Elmina, moving from one location to another. As a way of assisting her husband, she pays the utility bills. She wishes to use a loan through Kiva to invest in her business by buying more for clothes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio es una padre de familia de 36 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estos lugares desarrollan la actividad agícola, ganadera y turismo.

Lucio es agricultor desde hace algunos años, cuenta con varias hectáreas de terreno en los cuales cultiva limón,  este producto que cultiva es muy rentable,  ya que no necesita mucho tiempo para cosechar,  pero gracias a los ingresos que obtiene  puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y familia.

Por eso Lucio ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo y mejore su producción de limón, así pueda seguir creciendo su negocio e incrementando sus ganacias.

Lucio es un hombre responsable y trabajador, todo el esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo es para que su familia tenga más comodidades y ofrecerles a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Lucio is a 36-year-old father living with his wife and children.  He has a house of his own that only has electricity located in the rural part of Tambogrande District about 40 minutes from Piura Department.  All these places carry out farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Lucio has been a farmer for several years.  He has several hectares of land where he grows lemons.  This product he grows is very profitable because it doesn’t require a lot of time to harvest.  Thanks to the income he earns he’s able to meet household and family expenses.

Because of this Lucio has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan through its Seed Capital program to buy fertilizer for his fields to improve his lemon production so that he can continue growing in business and increasing his profits.

Lucio is a responsible, hard working man.  He puts all this effort into his work so that his family will have more comforts and to provide his children with other life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Namulanda Development Group

texts.en: Daniel, a hardworking 38-year-old, has been in the retail business for the past decade. He operates from Kayunga. This happily married father of 4 says that to get established in this business, he had to use savings from his agricultural sales business. He still runs his agri-sales business, though it is now a secondary business. Weekly, he says his business generates for him 100,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more general merchandise retail commodities to resell.  Daniel is the gentleman seated in the front-row with a white shirt.

loans.use: purchase more sugar, salt and so on to resell in the shop.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a cousin).   

Sarah has a business of selling of timber. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products from home, by means of wholesale. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more timber. She also generates additional income through selling passion juice.The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own rental rooms and also to own a delivery van. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more timber for resale.

loans.name: Gemelos Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "GEMELOS", PORQUE GRACIAS AL NACIMIENTO DE UNOS GEMELOS DE LA HERMANA DE UNA DE LAS INTREGANTES LES TRAJO BENDICION A SU ACTIVIDADA LABORAL Y DECIDIERON LLAMARLO ASI PARA TRAER ESA MISMA BENDICION PARA EL GRUPO. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA BRENDA T. ES LA TESORERA  DEL GRUPO. ELLA TIENE 27 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL SEXTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA, VENDE ZAPATOS Y TIENE UN PUESTO DE GORDITAS. LA SEÑORA BRENDA TIENE 2 HIJOS (UN HOMBRE Y UNA MUJER). ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GORDITAS (MASA RELLENA DE FRIJOLES COCIDA EN UN COMAL CON SALSA Y QUESO) EL CUAL LO INICIO HACE 3 AÑOS SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER RENTAR UN LOCAL Y COMPRAR UN PAR DE MESAS PARA DARLE MAS SANIDAD YA QUE TRABAJA EN LA ESQUINA DE SU CASA Y MESAS PARA DARLE UNA MEJOR IMAGEN Y MAYOR COMODIDAD A SUS COMENSALES LOS CUALES LA HAN FELICITADO POR EL CAMBIO QUE PIENSA REALIZAR Y POR PENSAR EN ELLOS Y TENER MAS VARIEDAD DE ANTOJITOS. ELLA SE SIENTE EXITOSA Y AGRADECIDA POR LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE SE LE BRINDA. TAMBIEN ESPERA CON ESTE MEJORAMIENTO SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SU ESPOSO YA QUE EL ES ALBAÑIL Y NO TIENE UN INGRESO ESTABLE.
TAMBIEN DESEA DARLE UNA MEJOR EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA NO LO TUVO.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Gemelos' (Twins) because when the sister of one of the group's members gave birth to twins, it brought a blessing to their business activities.  For this reason, they decided to give their group the same name so that it might receive the same blessing.  The group is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico.

Brenda T. is the group's treasurer.  She is 27 years old, studied up to the sixth year of elementary school, and sells shoes.  She also has a stall where she sells 'gorditas' (stuffed corn cakes).  Brenda has two children (a son and a daughter).  She started making her 'gorditas' three years ago.  Her 'gorditas' are stuffed with beans that have been cooked on a special hotplate with salsa and cheese.

Brenda is requesting this loan so that she can rent business premises and also pay a couple of months' rent so that she can work more hygienically as she currently works in the corner of her home.  In addition, she would like to buy tables so that she can present a better image and provide more comfort to her diners who have congratulated her on the change that she is planning to make and for having thought of them.  She would like to also offer a wider range of snacks.

Brenda feels successful and grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  She hopes that, with this improvement, she will be able to continue helping her husband since he is a construction worker and doesn't have a stable income.  She would also like to provide her children with a better education as she didn't receive a good education herself.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es madre de familia de 40 años de edad, tiene su casa propia donde vive con sus hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Cristina es la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), desde hace 4 años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganacias para cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  También cuenta con algunas tierras de cultivo donde siembra plantas de limón. 

Cristina solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para venderlos a un mejor precio y también lo va utilizar para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivoy pueda tener una buena producción de limón. Cristina  es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque es una persona que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el ideal que en un futuro cercano pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 40-year-old mother.  She has a house of her own where she lives with her children.  The only utility the house has is electricity.  It’s located in Tambogrande District about 40 minutes from Piura Department.  These areas are dedicated to farming, livestock raising and crafts.

Cristina’s activity is raising goats to sell.  She’s been in this line of work for 4 years.  The place where she raises the animals is the back yard of her house.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the various markets since she has an established clientele in the city of Piura.  This allows her to obtain higher profits to meet her family obligations.  She also has some farmland where she grows lemons.

Cristina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy animal feed so that they will be well fed and she will be able to sell them for a better price.  She will also use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland to obtain a good production of lemons.

Cristina is very well known where she lives because she’s someone who is always concerned about the wellbeing of her loved ones with the ideal in mind that in the near future she’ll be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: El señor Faustino es un cliente antiguo de la institución y ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y cortes en la evaluación que se le hizo, El Sr. Faustino cuenta con un puesto de negocio en la avenida principal del distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco.  El tiene una renovadora de zapatos que esta implementada con las necesidades básicas como por ejemplo una maquina, cuero, hilos, clavos, goma y otras cosas más. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio ye le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Faustino requiere el microcrédito para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cuero e hilos.
texts.en: Faustino is a long time client of the institution and he has demonstrated a determination to make his payments. He was kind and courteous when the evaluation took place. Faustino has a stand on the main street of the district of San Jeronimo in the city of Cusco. He has a cobbler business and it is installed with the basic tools, for example, a sewing machine, leather, threads, nails, glue, and other products. He has been in business for the past 8 years and it has gone very well, thanks to the care he invests in his work. Faustino requires a loan to purchase materials, for example leather and threads.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as leather and threads for his cobbler business.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Medius has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Medius sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Medius has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Medius include defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked restaurant. Medius lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food items like bunches of bananas, cassava, beef and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: La señora Petronila tiene 43 años es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella es una cliente antigua de la institución y ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y cortes en la evaluación que se le hizo, La señora Petronila se dedica a la venta de materiales agregados que sirven para construir casas y edificios. En esta oportunidad Petronila requiere el microcrédito para comprar materiales como por ejemplo arena, piedras y hormigón.
texts.en:
Petronila, 43, is married and has three children.  She is a longstanding client of the institution and has shown good willingness to pay and a kind and courteous behavior during the evaluation she underwent.

Petronila sells aggregates that are used in building and home construction.  On this occasion, Petronila needs a micro loan to buy materials like sand, stone and concrete.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She’s married and is a mother of two children. Her husband is a school teacher and all of their children are attending school. Fatu, who has sold drinks in her community for a livelihood for the past years, enjoys her business. According to Fatu, she makes a lot of profit and it enables her to send her children to school.

Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (soda, beer, etc.), for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soda, beer, etc.), for her business.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La señora Nieves tiene 29 años es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella es una cliente antigua de la institución y ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y cortés en la evaluación que se le hizo. La señora Nieves y su esposo Vidal se dedican al transporte y venta de agua, ellos llevan agua en su carro a diferentes pueblitos de la ciudad del Cusco donde no hay mucha agua. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a la venta de agua y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Nieves requiere el microcrédito para hacer mantenimiento del carro ya que es la única fuente de ingreso económico pues tiene que estar en buen estado para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Nieves is 29 years old, married, and the fruit of her relationship is her three children. She is a long time client of the institution and she has demonstrated a determination to make her payments. She was kind and courteous at the time of evaluation. Nieves and her husband, Vidal, transport and sell water. They carry water in their car to different communities in their city of Cusco where there isn't very much water. She has been selling water for 7 years and it has been successful thanks to the care she invests in her business. Nieves requires a loan to carry out maintenance repairs to her car. It is their only source of income and the car must be in a good state of repair to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to her car.

loans.name: Pascual Adriel

texts.es: El señor Pascual nació en la ciudad de Paucarpata  del distrito de Cusipata y  tiene 57 años, él señor Pascual es trasportista y tiene su propio carro. Ya son 38 años que se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Pascual y su esposa tiene  una negocio de venta de comida ósea tiene una pequeña restaurante. En esta oportunidad Pascual requiere el microcrédito para hacer mantenimiento del carro.
texts.en:
Pascual was born in the city of Paucarpata, Cusipata district.  He’s 57 years old.  He provides transportation services and has his own car.  He’s been providing transportation services for 38 years and does well thanks to the dedication he puts into his work.

Pascual and his wife have a food sales business, that is, he has a small restaurant.  On this occasion, Pascual needs the micro loan to service his car.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 31 years old and lives in West Point. She’s a school dropout, of only grade 6. She has 2 children, one of whom attends school.


Musu has been selling used clothes for the past 4 years and she enjoys it a lot. She’s requesting a loan to buy 2 cartons of use clothes for her business. She plans and hopes to be a successful business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to buy 2 cartons of use clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in a neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Rebecca has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rebecca sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail. Rebecca has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of passion fruits, oranges, eggplants, cabbages and tomatoes. She also generates additional income through a motorcycle for hire. The main business challenge(s) for Rebecca include seasonality and perishability of goods. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing vegetables herself and to buy a plot of land where she can grow more fruits and vegetables.   

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, feeding the family and school fees for her four children.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fruit like oranges, cabbages, tomatoes and passion fruit.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has one child in school. Lydia   has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and works 7 days out of every week. Lydia sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Lydia are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she can own a fully stocked restaurant. Lydia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Flor De Habitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de carnicería, tienda de abarrotes, comercio, venta de alimentos, venta de dulces.
 
La señora Martha,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de las promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en general, que viene trabajando hace tiempo y tiene experiencia en el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para surtir su mercadería (compra de aceite, enlatados, abarrotes, etc.), este material lo compra de la cuidad de El Alto, de la Ceja (calle comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en su domicilio, sitio donde esta ubicado su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.

En la fotografía no pararece con nitides don Hector, pues se encuentra sentado al final de la izquierda.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE HABITAS” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Center.  It has ten members and is led by a governing board headed by Martha.  The businesses of the member are varied.  Among them we have: butcher shop, grocery store, commerce, food sales and candy sales.

Martha indicates that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer and that she joined thanks to an invitation from the promoters.  She currently has a general store that she’s been running for some time now and she has experience in the business.

The loan she’s taking out now is to stock her merchandise (to purchase oil, canned goods, groceries, etc.)  She buys these supplies in the city of El Alto, in La Ceja (commercial street in the city of El Alto) and she’ll sell them in her own home which is where her store is located.  This way of working allows her to generate income to help her family in any way possible since she’s married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loan.

In the photo, Hector can’t be seen clearly because he’s seated at the extreme left.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, es casado, vive en compañía de su esposa y 6 hijos, dentro de ellos hay gemelos sus edades son de 21,18,18, 17, 15 y 12 años, él trabaja en la ganadería tiene muchos años dedicándose a esta actividad, ya que su padre era ganadero por lo que le creció ayudando a su padre y aprendiendo el trabajo, su horario es de 5:00am a 5:00pm.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado, cerdos y comprara abono y semilla para sembrar maíz, este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar el número de animales tanto ganado como cerdos, también realizara la siembra que le ayuda mucho para el consumo familiar. 
Para lucio es una gran oportunidad este préstamo, pues beneficia a su negocio y al mismo tiempo su familia tendrá mejor alimentación por el crecimiento comercial que tendrá.
texts.en:
Lucio is married and lives with his wife and six children, among whom are twins. Their ages are 21, 18, 18, 17, 15 and 12 years. He works with livestock and has dedicated many years to this business since his father was also a cattle farmer. Thus he grew up helping his father and learning the work. His schedule is from 5 a.m. until 5 p.m. 

He is seeking a loan for the purchase of cattle and pigs, and will also buy fertilizer and seeds for sowing corn. This loan will help him increase the number of animals, both cattle and pigs. He will also grow corn, which helps greatly with the family budget. 

For Lucio this loan is a big opportunity, since it will benefit his business and likewise his family will be better fed because of the commercial growth he will see.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and pigs along with fertilizer and seeds for growing corn.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 45 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 13, 11 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos secos, la socia vende papa. Maíz, cebada, trigo, habas, moraya, chuño. La socia tiene un pequeño stand en el mercado y la socia compra al por mayor productos y los hace secar para la venta de productos en este género, la socia desea poder comprar al por mayor maíz en todos los tipos y en forma de granos poder venderlos ahora que comenzará la nueva etapa de siembra de maíz, La socia suele tener clientes que tienen terrenos agrícolas y buscan semillas para la siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos de maíz para la venta.

 La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” community bank.  She lives in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 13 and 11.  Her business is buying and selling dried products.  She sells potato, corn, barley, wheat, beans, 'moraya' (washed frozen potatoes) and chuño (frozen potatoes).  She has a small stand in the market where she sells her products wholesale.  She dries her products before she sells them.

The borrower would like to buy all kinds of corn wholesale, in kernel form.  She will then sell them now that the new corn-growing season is starting.  The borrower's customers own their own farmland and are looking for seeds to sow.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying corn kernels to sell.

The borrower appreciates this loan and is infinitely grateful for it since it will allow her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to invest in buying corn kernels to sell

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es:
Higinio, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 17, 15 años de edad, él se dedica a las labores agropecuarias, crianza de ganado y cultivos de maíz y frijol, inicia sus labores a las 4:00am hasta las 4:00pm, aprendió en su familia cuando le ayudaba a su padre.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra insumos agrícolas (abono y fertilizantes), también unas vacas, con este financiamiento cubrirá gastos muy necesarios para realizar sus labores, como son la inversión en ganado al igual que en la agricultura.
Él tiene la esperanza de fortalecer el negocio con esta inversión, acompañado de mucho trabajo espera tener una buena cosecha y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Higinio lives with his family, composed of his wife and their four children, aged 19, 18, 17, and 15. He is a farmer who raises cattle and cultivates corn and beans. He works from 4:00am to 4:00pm. He learned the trade from his family, while helping his father. He requests a loan to purchase agricultural inputs (fertilizers), and to purchase a few cattle. This loan will help him cover the expenses incurred by his work, including the investment of purchasing new livestock, and investments in his agricultural projects. His hope is to strengthen his loan through this investment and with hard work. He hopes to have a good harvest, to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and cattle.

loans.name: Chuija Group

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 36 años de edad, sabe leer y escribir,  tiene 4 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos, la confeccion de camisas, inicio trabajando para una maquila, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR, ya que quiere ampliar su capital de trabajo, el préstamo lo utilizará para compra de telas, botones, hilos, ya en el futuro que quiere ver su negocio como una maquila y que genére empleos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, confección de playeras, y al comercio a la venta de pants.
texts.en:
