Magdalena, 36, knows how to read and write.  She has four children one of whom is studying.  She weaves textiles and manufactures shirts.  She started out working in an assembly plant and to date has 10 years experience.

She decided to put together a group to request a loan from ASDIR because she wants to expand her working capital.  She’ll use the loan to buy fabric, buttons and thread because in the future she’d like her business to be like an assembly plant and generate employment.  

The other group members raise animals, manufacture t-shirts and sell athletic pants.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies.

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Huitzililla se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Huitzililla, en México, está conformado por la señora Margarita va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, galletas, cloro etc. Para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Maribel va a compra zapatos de dama, caballero y niños para surtir sus pedidos, el joven Santiago va a comprar Refrescos y la señora Juana va a comprar  ingredientes para preparar pasta de mole rojo.  

La señora Juana tiene 35 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos Elizabeth tiene 16 años de edad ya no estudia le ayuda a su mamá en la casa, Luis Damián tiene 14 años de edad estudia la secundaria, Analitzi tiene 10 años de edad estudia la primaria, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar los ingredientes para preparar la pasta de mole rojo va a comprar chile ancho, mulato, pasilla, guajillo, ajonjolí, cacahuate, almendra, pasas, semilla, cominos, pimienta, clavos, chocolate, aceite, plátanos etc. Ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años, como prepara muy sabroso el mole rojo su tía le dijo que vendiera pasta de mole y le prestó dinero para comprar los ingredientes, es así como ella y su hija salen a vender por las calles de Huitzililla su pasta de mole con las señoras ama de casa, a ella también la contratan en las fiestas para preparar el mole es por eso que le gusta tener en existencia los insumos para preparar el mole rojo. 

Este negocio es importante porque le ha ayudado a su familia cuando más lo necesita con los gastos de la escuela, las inscripciones, los uniformes, también puede cubrir los gastos de su casa como la luz, el gas y la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que le valla mejor en la familia y en el negocio y a sus hijos dejarles algo y enseñarles como tener su propio negocio. 

Huitzililla es un pueblo donde siembran sorgo, maíz, cebolla, celebran el 21 de diciembre a Santo Tomas hay misas, procesión, primeras comuniones, toros. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por la confianza que nos dan que aunque ganamos poco somos personas que si nos gusta pagar y que sigan teniendo confianza para seguir ayudando a más personas que lo necesitan”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Huitzililla.  It is located in the community of Huitzililla, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  The group's members are: Margarita, who will use her loan to buy soft drinks, cookies, bleach, etc. with which to stock her grocery store; Maribel, who will buy men's, ladies' and children's shoes to fill some orders; young Santiago, who will buy soft drinks and Juana, who will buy ingredients for making red 'mole' chili paste.

Juana is 35 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and three children: 16 year-old Elizabeth who no longer attends school but helps her mom around the house; 14 year-old Luis Damián who is in high school, and 10 year-old Analitzi who is in elementary school.  Juana requested her loan to buy ingredients for making red 'mole' chili paste.  She will buy dried Poblano chilis, Mulato chilis, Pasilla chilis, Guajillo chilis, sesame seeds, peanuts, almonds, raisins, seeds, cumin, pepper, cloves, chocolate, oil, plantains, etc.  She started her business three years ago.  As she makes very tasty red 'mole' chili sauce, her aunt said that she should sell red 'mole' paste and loaned her the money to buy ingredients.  Juana and her daughter go out to sell their 'mole' paste to local housewives.  People also hire her for parties so that she can prepare their 'mole' sauce.  For this reason, she likes to have in stock the supplies she needs to prepare her red 'mole' paste.

Juana's business is important because it has helped her family, when they have most needed it, in covering school expenses, registration fees and uniforms.  It has also helped to cover household expenses such as electricity, gas and food bills.  Juana's dreams and hopes are for her family and her business to do better and for her to be able to leave her children something and teach them how to run their own business.

Huitzililla is a village where people grow sorghum, corn and onions.  They celebrate San Tomas on December 21st each year and there are masses, processions, first communions and bullfighting.  The group's members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for the trust that you have placed in us.  Although we are people who don't earn much, we are also people who like to pay back our debts.  We hope that you continue trusting and continue helping more people who need it".

loans.use: to buy dried Poblano chilis, Mulato chilis, Pasilla chilis, Guajillo chilis, sesame seeds, peanuts, almonds, raisins, seeds, cumin, pepper, cloves, oil, chocolate and plantains to make red mole chili paste.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento LA FAMILIA, es uno D. los bancos más antiguos D. la Institución, viene trabajando con nosotros hace 3 años atrás. La mayoría D. sus integrantes se dedica al comercio y servicio, el Sr. REYNALDO es el Presidente del banco, lo eligieron por su responsabilidad y dinamismo, el Sr. Reynaldo es casado con la Sra. María Quien es profesora, D. esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar,  tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, y el Sr. tiene un taller D. mecánica automotriz hace bastantes años, donD. le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes, y con el dinero del préstamo equipara su taller comprando herramientas necesarias para un realizar un buen trabajo. y mejorar su ingresos económicos, el Sr. Reynaldo desea con el tiempo inaugurar un nuevo taller y el D. ver a sus hijos profesionales, es una persona trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The “La Familia” communal bank is one of the Institution’s oldest; it’s been working with us for three years.  Most of its members are merchants and Reynaldo is bank President. He was chosen for his dynamism and responsibility. He is married to Maria who is a teacher. In this way she contributes to the household expenses.They have two school aged children. He has had a machine shop for many years, where things are going well and he has many clients. With the loan, he will he will equip his workshop purchasing the necessary tools to do a good job and improve his income. With time, he would like to inagurate a new workshop and see his children become professionals.  He is a hard working person who is appreciative of the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Para Equipar su taller con la Compra de herramientas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Kassofor Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles sont pour la plus part des vendeuses au marché local.

Madame MARIAMA qui est gauche de la photo levant la main est le responsable. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en charge cinq autres enfants qui lui ont été confié par ses frères.

Elle fait un petit commerce de mangues et d'oranges. Elle a une expérience avérée dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was formed July 10, 2002. They all live in the same neighborhood. Most of them sell at the local market.

Mrs. Mariama to the left of the photo raising her hand is the group leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and a mother of six. She is also responsible for five other children of whom her brothers left her in charge.

She buys and sells mangos and oranges. She has proven experience in this business, since she's been doing it for several years.

The profits from this business will allow her to support her husband in improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oranges and mangoes

loans.name: Sacabeñas Group

texts.es: El grupo SACABEÑAS esta compuesto por 8 personas  D. las cuales la mesa directiva se encuentra compuesto D. la siguiente manera: la presidenta es la Sra. Ruth vive en alquiler como 3 años que esta por la zona D. Quintanilla, vive junto con su  hijos  y su esposo, la señora Ruth es  buena líder y se dedica a la venta D. comida en una avenida muy populosa que se encuentra en el centro D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, le va muy bien con la venta D. comida y el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. abarrotes e insumos para la elaboración D. sus comidas; la tesorera es la señora Inés que  vive en  casa familiar D. la Mama D. su esposo,  vive junto a su hija y su esposo, se dedica a la venta D. huevo y carne,  ambulando en la zona y en la cancha D. papas D. sacaba, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como huevo por cajas, Dicho grupo D.  8 personas se conocen muy bien por que un 70% del grupo se ven casi diariamente por los negocios que tienen,  el único varón del grupo es soldador.  El grupo solicita  el crédito para la invertir en sus negocios.	Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The group SACABEÑAS is maD. up of 8 members.  The board is comprised as follows:  Señora Ruth is the president.  She has been renting a home in the Quintanilla zone with her husband and children for 3 years.  Señora Ruth is a good leader.  She sells food for a living on a busy street in the center of the city of Cochabamba.  Things are going well with her sales and she will use the loan to buy groceries and supplies to prepare her foods.  

The treasurer is Señora Inés.  She lives in the family home of her mother-in-law with her husband and daughter.  She sells meat and eggs as a street vendor as well as in the fields where they pick potatoes.  With the loan she will buy merchandise such as cartons of eggs.

This group of 8 members is well-known because 70% of the group is seen almost daily because of the businesses that they have.  The only man in the group is a welder.  The group is requesting a loan to invest in their businesses.  All the members are responsible and hard-working people who are grateful to the institution for the support they give.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Belle Groupe

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est constituer de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui ont la même vision. Elles s'activent tous dans le petit commerce.

Madame BINTA qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main et le responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en charge deux autres enfant confié par ses voisines. 

Elle s'active dans la vente et l'achat de produits divers dans les marchés de la ville. Elle a une très bonne expérience de ce domaine d'activité, car elle l'a pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on July 10, 2002. It consists of women who live in the same neighborhood and who have the same vision. They are all in retail.

Mrs. Binta, who is at the left in the photo with her hand raised is the group leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and a mother of eight. She also supports two other children of whom her neighbors left her in charge.

She buys and sells diverse products in the city markets. She is very experienced in this, as she’s been doing it for several years.

This loan will allow her to provide for her personal needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy diverse products

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de divers produits (porcelaine et pagnes…) depuis 1989  et mariée à un photographe professionnelle. Mme Afi a 46 ans et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne de temps en temps au grand marché de Lomé et revend à domicile à toutes les couches sociales. Avec ce second crédit elle veut sortir son activité de la maison  pour se faire connaître de la population et  accroître son commerce.
texts.en: Seller of diverse products (porcelain and "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)…) since 1989 and married to a professional photographer. Madame Afi is 46 years old and a mother of five. She stocks up from time to time at the grand market of Lomé and sells from her house. With this second loan she wants to get her business out of her house to get to know the population and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy porcelain and pagnes (colorful African cloths)

loans.name: Amautas Cerro Kantica Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAUTAS CERRO KANTICA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: sahumerios, macramé de mantas, y venta de comida.
 
La señora Virginia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de las promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de sahumerio que aprendió de su familia, desde hace cuatro años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería de sahumerios (compra de inicencios, copal, dulces, etc.), este material lo compra de la cuidad de El Alto, de la Ceja, de la calle Corazón de Jesús (calle comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en su negocio que esta ubicado, camino a Laja. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “AMAUTAS CERRO KANTICA” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Center.  It has nine members and is led by a governing board headed by Virginia.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses.  Among them are: sahumerios (aromatic herbals and incense), macramé weaving and food sales.

Virginia indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer and that she did so thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters.  She currently has a “sahumerio” (aromatic herbs and incense) business that she learned from her family; she’s had it for the last four years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her sahumerio merchandise (she will buy incense, copal, sweets, etc.)  She will buy these supplies in the city of El Alto’s La Ceja area, on Corazón de Jesús Street (a commercial street in El Alto) and will sell them in her store which is located on the road to Laja.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family in every possible say because she’s single and has two children.

loans.use: to buy aromatics.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama las Divinas se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por las señoras Valeria e Ignacia van a comprar con su préstamo dulces típicos para surtir su negocio, la señora Alfonsa va a comprar maíz y leña para elaborar tortillas, la señora Maribel va a comprar alimento para engordar sus cerdos y la señora Diana va a comprar blusas y ropa de dama para surtir su negocio. 
La señora Alfonsa tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Blanca tiene 13 años de edad está estudiando la secundaria, Yesenia tiene 11 años de edad estudia la primaria y Cristian tiene 19 años de edad ya trabaja, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas como chiles, tomates, jitomates, cebollas, mangos, plátanos, naranjas  para iniciar su negocio vendiendo en la plaza de Amilcingo, su esposo le va a ayudar a atender a los clientes y a poner y levantar el puesto, ella inicio su negocio por necesidad para tener ingresos y así poder ayudar a la familia, ella tiene la esperanza de vivir mejor, llevar una vida mejor, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo, se siente orgullosa y feliz por el préstamo que va a recibir y espera que sus hijos tengan una vida mejor. Amilcingo es un pueblo bonito elaboran dulces palanqueta de cacahuate, alegrías, tamarindo, jamoncillo, etc. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias porque nos han apoyado en todo y nos tiene calma para todo”.
texts.en:
This community bank group called Las Divinas is found in the community of Amilcingo, Temoac, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It was started by Mrs. Valeria and Mrs. Ignacia. With the loan, they will buy local candies to stock their business. Mrs. Alfonsa is going to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas. Mrs. Maribel will buy food for fattening her pigs, and Mrs. Diana is going to buy blouses and women's clothing to stock her business.

Mrs. Alfonsa is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Blanca is 13 years old and studies in secondary school. Yesenia is 11 years old and studies in primary school. Christian is 19 years old and works. She is asking for the loan to buy fruits and vegetables like chiles, tomatoes, onions, mangoes, bananas, and oranges to start a business selling in the Amilcingo Plaza. Her husband is going to help her with the customers and set up the stand. She started her business out of a need to have more income and be able to help her family. She has the hope of a better life. She is very happy with this loan and feels proud and happy to receive it. She hopes for her children to have a better life.

Amilcingo is a pretty village where they make peanut, alegria seed, tamarind, and fudge candies. The members of this group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad “thanks, because you have supported us through everything and have helped us feel more calm".

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La Capilla se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Anenecuilco, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por la señora Antonia y Teresa van a comprar jitomate, tomate, ejotes, chayotes, manzanas, plátanos, las señoras Araceli y Marciana van a comprar zapatos de  dama, caballero y niño para vender, la señora Porfiria va a comprar perfumes por mayoreo, la señora Ángela va a comprar sartenes, burros para planchar, baterías para cocinas, la señora Reyna va a comprar telas, hilos para su taller de costura, el señor Guadalupe va a comprar aceite, liquido para frenos para su taller mecánico, la señora Petra va a comprar chicharrones, paletas, caramelo para vender, la seora Silvia va a comprar labiales, perfumes, barnices en catalogo por mayoreo, la señora María Tereza va a comprar maderas para rentar a personas que se dedican a la contrucción.  
La señora María Tereza tiene 53 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 6 hijos  Coral de 33 años de edad, Guillermo de 27 años de edad, Alma de 28 años, Cristal de 16 años de edad ellos son casados ya trabajan, Perla Teresa tiene 31 años de edad y Juan Calos de 30 años de edad ellos dos son soltero, ella tiene su negocio de renta de madera para construcción, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar madera para tener más mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes los albañiles, su esposo le enseño este trabajo, él es albañil, ellos vendieron su casa que tenían en Cuautla y con este dinero compraron el terreno, compraron el material y su esposo construyo la casa y el negocio, su negocio es importante porque tienen un trabajo que le da para los alimentos y para todos los gastos de su casa, ella está orgullosa con su negocio porque cada vez tiene más clientes que van a rentar la madera y es conocido por el buen trato a los clientes, las ganancias las invierte en la casa y en las casa de sus hijos, ella recuerda cuando no tenia su negocio la pasaban muy difícil no había para comer. Este negocio le ha ayudado a su familia económicamente ellos han mejorado sus casas, ella tiene la esperanza de dejarle a su hija la pequeña con casa y que sus hijos estén bien contentos, sanos y trabajando. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos muy agradecidos con ustedes, porque nos sacan de apuros y vamos a cumplir y que nos sigan ayudando, gracias”. Las integrantes Araceli y Angela no estan en la foto grupal y el señor que esta al final de la foto que tiene puesta la gorra es el esposo de la señora Angela y no forma parte del grupo.
texts.en:
This group called La Capilla is located in the community of Anenecuilco, in the city of Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. Mrs. Antonia and Mrs. Teresa are going to buy tomatoes, corn, chayote, apples, and bananas. Mrs. Araceli and Mrs. Marciana are going to buy women's men's and children's shoes to sell. Mrs. Porfiria is going to buy perfume in bulk. Mrs. Ángela is going to buy frying pans, ironing boards, and pots and pans. Mrs. Reyna is going to buy fabric and thread for her seamstress shop. Mr. Guadalupe is going to buy oil and brake fluid for his auto shop. Mrs. Petra is going to buy pork rinds, popsicles, and caramels to sell. Mrs. Silvia is going to buy lipstick, perfume, and nail polish in bulk through a catalog. Mrs. María Tereza is going to buy wood to rent to people who work in construction.

Mrs. María Tereza is 53 years old. She is married and has 6 children: Coral, 33; Guillermo, 27; Alma, 28; and Cristal, 16 are married and work. Perla Teresa is 41 and Juan Carlos is 30. They are both single. She has a business renting wood for construction. She is asking for the loan to buy wood to have more merchandise to offer to her customers. Her husband taught her this work. He is a mason. They sold their house they had in Cuautla and with that money they bought the land and materials and her husband built the house and the business. Their business is important because they have a job that will provide for their food and for the expenses of the home. She is proud of her business because her number of customers keeps growing and she is known for how well she treats them. She will invest her earnings in the house and in her children's houses. She remembers when she didn't have her own business and it was very difficult for them and they didn't always have enough to eat. This business has helped her family out financially and they have made improvements to their home. She hopes to leave her daughter the little house and hopes that her children are happy, healthy, and working.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad “we are very thankful for you because you have taken us out of a bad place. We will be responisble and hope you continue to help us. Thank you". Araceli and Angela are not in the group photo and the man at the end with the baseball cap is Angela's husband and is not part of the group.

loans.use: buy wood to rent

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both in school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. Roy has had a retail shop for a year, where she works 7 days a week. Roy  has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil to sell. Her main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see it grow into a wholesale business. Roy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags off sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en: Rhona lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Rhona has had a business selling firewood and charcoal in the market for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bundles of firewood. Her main business challenges are the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to have a tailoring school and also to start sewing bridal gowns. Rhona lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives  in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Mary has opereated a restaurant for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Mary sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bananas, beef, fish and rice. She also generates additional income through frying food to sell. Her main business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a full-scale restaurant. Mary lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bananas, beef, fish and rice to make food to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her in-laws. Rose has had a tailoring business for 10 years, and works seven days out of every week. She has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more   rolls of clothing materials. Her main business challenges include defaulters, transportation, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see it grow big so that she can employ girls to assist in tailoring. Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta de leña. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Es una persona muy humilde que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha sacado adelante a su familia, el siempre se preocupa por su hijo de 14 años que está bajo su cargo. Manuel ha logrado superar los obstáculos que ha enfrentado como ha sido las enfermedades que se le han presentado a su hijo, pero a pesar de todo ha logrado sobrellevar los problemas que se le presentan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de una gran cantidad de leña, para suplir la demanda de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en: Manuel De Jesús is 43 years old and works selling firewood.  He has worked at this for more than 13 years.  He is a humble person who has helped his family get ahead with a lot of effort and sacrifice.  He is always looking out for his 14 year old son who is under his care.  Manuel has overcome all the obstacles life has given him, including the illness of his son.  In spite of everything he has been able to overcome the problems that he faces.  He will use the loan to buy a lot of firewood to keep up with his customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of firewood.

loans.name: Anari Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANARI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, en esta ocación una jefa de grupo realizó la entrevista, ella es señora Lourdez. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda, venta de verduras, sembradío de verduras, confección de deportivos, venta de café.
 
La señora Lourdez,  indica que hace cinco años atrás trabajaba con Pro Mujer, posteriormente se retiró, ahora vuelve a trabajar en la institución por invitación de unas amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, que viene trabajando hace diez años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de sus papás..

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de verduras), que compra de la calle Rodríguez (calle comercial de la Cuidad de LA Paz) y los vende todos los días en la riel de Villa Dolores, desde las 5:30 hasta las 14:30. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The ANARI Community Group will complete its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Villa Exaltación. It is made up of eight members and directed by a group of leaders. In this instance, a head of the group interviewed for the loan. She is Mrs. Lourdez. The members' businesses are varied and include: a store, vegetable sales, planting vegetables, sports equipment, and coffee sales.

Mrs. Lourdez shared that she began working with Pro Mujer five years ago. She retired and now has returned after some friends invited her. She currently has a business selling vegetables and has been working at it for ten years after having learned the business from her parents.

The loan will be used to buy more vegetables on Rodríguez Street (a commercial street in the city of La Paz) and she will then sell them every day at the railroad in Villa Dolores every day form 5:30 am until 2:30 pm. This job lets her earn money to help support her family. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she resonded that she likes the health education and resources.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Lila Gloria

texts.es:
Lila  madre D. familia D. 51 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos D. agua y luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito D. la Victoria que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracterizan por su agricultura  y la mayoría son choferes D. transporte público que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Lila se dedica  a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad (leche, azúcar, arroz, detergente,  frugos,  golosinas, etc.), negocio que a colocado en su domicilio, en la cual sus  vecinos encuentran toda clase D. productos comestibles, también se dedica a a la crianza y venta D. ganado ovino (ovejas) una vez que los engorda y en su edad ideal los  venD. en los distintos mercados D. su zona y con los ingresos D. ambos negocios que tiene trata en lo posible D. brindar  un mejor nivel D. vida para su familia.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Lila trata D. adquirir un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para resalizar algunos acabados en su casa, como la parte posterior D. la misma para que esté más seguro su hogar,  al incrementarse sus ventas en ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como para seguir solventando sus obligaciones familiares.  Lila es una madre que con esfuerzo y trabajo trata que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Lila, 51, is a mother living in her own house with her husband and children.  The house has both water and electricity.  It is located in the rural part of La Victoria District which belongs to Chiclayo Province.   This zone is notedfor its agriculture and most residents are public transportation providers.

Lila sells basic need items (milk, sugar, rice, detergent, Frugo brand beverages, snacks, etc.)  The store is located in her home and her neighbors find  all kinds of foodstuffs there  She also raises sheep to sell. Once she fattens them up to ideal weight she sells them in the various markets in her area and uses income from both businesses to try to proviD. a better standard of living for her family.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Lila tries to acquire a 1000 new sol loan to do some home improvements, like in the rear, for example, to proviD. more security.  

Increasing sales in both businesses will make it possible for her to repay the loan while still meeting her family obligations.  Lila is a mother who, with effort and hard work, tries to move her family forward.

loans.use: to do some improvements to the rear of her house.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 37 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos y su esposo  en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 1 año se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos y golosinas en un puesto de venta que tiene y que se encuentra dentro de un terreno que le heredó por parte de sus padres Hoy le permiten ejercer el negocio de venta de comida que junto a su esposo formaron este negocio. Es así que cada mañana prepara platos típicos, además de ofrecer un ambiente acogedor y campestre su establecimiento lo cual lo hace atractivo para el público. Por otro lado también ofrece desayunos y comidas para los trabajadores de construcción que laboran cerca de su casa. De esta manera se genera mayor rentabilidad, y eso le ha sido muy rentable para su negocio, a pesar del alza de los precios de los alimentos. Por tanto espera abastecerse de ingredientes no perecibles al por mayor ya que así reduce el costo de su inversión. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP,  esta muy entusiasmada de saber que tendrá una experiencia con expectativa de éxito por lo que esta decidido a tener un actitud responsable para tener un record crediticio favorable y acceder a un nivel mas de confianza y a la vez agradece por esta oportunidad de apoyo en su crédito que le servirá para mejorar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres al por mayor.
texts.en: Martha is 37 years old and lives with her two children and husband in her parents' home.  More than a year ago she began selling food, juice, and sweets at a stand she has on land inherited by her parents.  Now they allow her to run a business selling food with her husband.  Every morning she prepares typical dishes and offers a rural atmosphere that is attractive to the public.  She also offers breakfasts and food for the construction workers who work near her house.  In this way she has achieved greater profits and this has helped her business, in spite of the rising price of food.  She hopes to stock non-perishable ingredients by buying in bulk to save money.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is very excited knowing she will likely have success.  She has a responsible attitude and wants to build a good credit history to achieve a greater level of trust and she is thankful for the opportunity for the loan that will help her improve her business.   She will buy food in bulk with this loan.

loans.use: Buy non-perishable products in bulk

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
María de 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Ferreñafe a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Acá sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

María tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Lucia desde hace unos 4 años, donde vende carne de cerdo, actividad que le permite tener ingresos diarios y cuenta con su propia clientela.  Al ver que su negocio día  a día va creciendo más a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de carne de cerdo y también para cubrir algunos gastos personales, cada vez su clientela se ha ido incrementando en su negocio, lo que le permitirá poder pagar su préstamo y poder ayudar a solventar algunos  gastos de la  casa de sus padres.

María es conocido por ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es más adelante pueda realizar unos estudios para seguir ayudando a sus padres a tenr una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 24, is single living in her parents’ house located in an urban part of Ferreñafe District about 15 minutes from Chiclayo Province.  Residents here are in farming, cattle raising and tourism.

María has had a stand in the Santa Lucia market for about four years where she sells pork, an activity that allows her to earn daily income; she has her own clientele.  Seeing that her business is growing more day by day she thought it necessary to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger amounts of pork as well as to cover some personal expenses.  Her clientele in her business has been growing and this will make it possible for her to repay the loan and help cover some of the expenses in her parents’ house.

María is known for being a hard working, responsible person.  The only thing she wants is to later on undertake some schooling to continue to help her parents to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pork and cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José es soltero de 24 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual  es propia y cuenta con los servicio agua y luz ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, a una hora del departamento de Lamabayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y tiene festividades religiosas que forma parte de las costumbres de los pobladores.

José  labora como chofer de su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 1 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito y a caseríos aledaños, apesar de la competencia, el trata en lo posible de ganarse su propia clientela con mucho esfuerzo, para así tener mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades persdonales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1800 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos repuestos que necesita su mototaxi para poder seguir trabajando y brindando un buen servicio con seguridad para sus pasajeros, pero también con las ganacias  que obtiene podrá ayudar a sus padres a tener una mejor calidad de vida para lo suyos.  José es una persona de confianza y trabajadora  que lo único que quiere es poder adquirir otra mototaxi para alquilarla y tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José, 24, is single living in his parents’ house which they own and that has water and electricity; it’s located in Olmos district an hour from Lambayeque Department.  Residents of this district are in farming, cattle raising and have religious festivals that form part of their customs.

José has worked as a mototaxi driver (mode of transportation used for short distances with a maximum capacity of 3 passengers) for about a year.  He carries out this activity in his own district and adjacent hamlets.  Despite competition, he tries his best to win over customers with much effort in order to have M. income to meet his expenses and personal needs.

The loan he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa is for 1800 new soles that will be used to service the mototaxi and to buy some replacement parts for it in order to continue working and providing good, safe customer service.  In addition, he will be able to use profits he earns to help his parents have a better quality of life for their loved ones.  

José is a trustworthy, hard working person.  His only wish is to acquire another mototaxi to lease it out and have M. income.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi and buy some spare parts for it.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es madre soltera que vive con su pequeño hijo en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 5 años decidió trabajar de manera dependiente para tener tiempo en la atención de su hijo que en aquel entonces era un bebe, es así que con apoyo de su madre emprendió este negocio y hoy le genera rentas. Ella prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena para 15 clientes fijos que tiene, más las ventas diarias de almuerzo que hace al día. Es así que su trabajo comienza desde las primeras horas de la mañana para la preparación de variados platillos. Últimamente la cantidad de clientela ha aumentado, por lo que tendrá que ampliar su establecimiento y hacerla más acogedora. Es su crédito número 10 con MFP, tiene amplia experiencia de trabajo solidario dentro de su banco comunal y se siente muy  contenta de  ser una de las integrantes  que ha demostrado ser muy colaboradora  y puntual en sus pagos, en la actualidad esta agradecida por renovar su compromiso de puntualidad y agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras de su crédito. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de nuevas sillas, cuadros y también algunos ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en: Aurora is a single mother, who lives with her young son in her parents' house. She decided to be self-employed 5 years ago in order to spend enough time with her son, who was a baby at the time. With the help of her mother, she began this business which now generates profit. She prepares breakfast, lunch and supper for 15 permanent customers that she has, and sells lunchtime meals to others every day. She begins to prepare various dishes early in the morning. Recently, the number of customers has increased and, as a result, she needs to enlarge her establishment and make it more welcoming. This is her 10th loan from MFP. She has considerable experience with her communal bank. She is very pleased to be one of its members. She has proven very cooperative and is punctual in making her payments. She now renews her commitment to make all her payments on schedule and is very grateful to all those who have made this loan possible. With the loan, she will invest in new chairs, pictures and also some non-perishable ingredients for her dishes.

loans.use: To buy chairs, pictures and non-perishable goods.

loans.name: Fatmata's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the RC Hanga, situated in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in September 1970 by the Catholic Mission. RC Hanga school is staffed with 22 able teachers and has an enrollment of 810 pupils.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Fatmata, 44 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. She was born in Bunumbu and has been in the teaching profession for 25 years. Fatmata is married and has 2 children – one in primary school and one in secondary school. Fatmata has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 for developmental purposes. She would like to buy house building materials such as bags of cement for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials to construct a house

loans.name: Las Amorocitas De Cascada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS AMOROCITAS DE CASCADA” iniciará su cuarto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Beatriz. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de carne de pollo, trenzado de mantas, tienda comercial, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, costura de polleras, venta de ropa.

La señora Beatriz,  indica que es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las promotoras que fueron a su casa a invitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en su casa que inicio hace dos años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su suegra.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital en su tienda (compra de abarrotes, enlatados, aceites, etc.) que comprará de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la Cuidad de El Alto) y lo venderá en su tienda todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The “LAS AMOROCITAS DE CASCADA” (Cascada’s Little Loving Ones) communal bank will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It has nine members and is led by a governing board headed by Beatriz.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: chicken sales, blanket weaving, store, food sales, textile braiding, t-shirt making and clothes sales.

Beatriz indicates that this is the first time she’s joined a communal bank in Pro Mujer having been invited by the promoters who visited her in her home to invite her.  She currently has a store in her house that she started two years ago learning from her mother-in-law.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her store’s capital (she’ll buy groceries, canned goods, oil, etc.)  She will make her purchases in La Ceja (commercial sector in the city of El Alto) and will sell them in her store every day.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family in any way possible since she’s single and has two children

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
Juan es padre de familia de 34 años, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposa e hijos la cula cuenta con los servicio de agua y luz  en  el caserío de Punto Nueve, zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan  labora manejando su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito, pero también tiene unas tierras de cultivo, al tener su mototaxi puede ir a ver sus tierras más seguido.  Ambas actividades le permite tener más ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares. 

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles y su destino será para la  compra de fertilizantes para preparar y mejorar sus tierras y pueda tener una mejor producción.  Juan es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es salir adelante  y como todo padre quiere darle a su familia las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en:
Juan, 34, is a father.  He owns his house where he lives with his wife and children.  The house has water and electricity and is located in Punto Nuevo, a rural part of Lambayeque Department.  Residents here are farmers and raise livestock.

Juan has been working driving his mototaxi (mode of transportation used for short distances able to carry a maximum of three passengers) for about five years.  He carries out this work in his own district.  However, he also has farmland and having a mototaxi makes it possible for him to visit his fields more often.  Both activities allow him to have more income to cover family expenses.

The loan he asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 500 new soles that he’ll use to buy fertilizer to prepare the soil and improve his land to have a better crop yield. 

Juan is a very hard working, responsible person.  All he wants is to get ahead and, like all fathers, provide his family with the comfort they deserve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz se dedica a la elaboración de repostería. Desde hace más de 12 años, es una persona muy entregada y disfruta de su negocio. Alba a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para poder brindarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias, actualmente ella realiza su trabajo todos los días pues. A ella le gusta mucho trabajar en la elaboración de sus queques, pasteles, semitas, picos, bocadillos entre otros, aunque siempre le es difícil lograr complacer a sus clientes que le solicitan encargos muy complicados, pero los termina logrando. Este crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, colorantes, herramientas entre otros.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is a pastry maker.  She’s been in business for over 12 years.  She is a very dedicated woman who enjoys her work.  All through her life, Alba has worked hard to provide her family with necessary comforts so she currently works every day.

She enjoys making cakes, pies, semitas, picos, and bocadillos (types of pastry and rolls), among others.  Although it’s often difficult for her to please customers that make complicated requests, in the end she always manages to do so.  

This loan is to buy flour, eggs, food coloring and tools, among others.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, food coloring and tools, among others.

loans.name: Julia Charito

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta  con el servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Panga, a 20 minutos  de la provincia de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la comercialización de animales y agricultura.

Desde hace 5 años Julia se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de aves de corral (pavos, gallinas y gallos) y ganado porcino (cerdos), sus  corrales se encuentran a unos minutos de su casa.  Sus animales los alimenta con dieta balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo ideal los ofrece a los pobladores de su zona como lo comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Chepén, lo cual le permite aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Por lo mismo Julia a solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para comprar más animales porcinos y alimentos balanceados, ambas cosas van ayudar a que la venta de sus animales se incremente, permitiéndole cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  El objetivo de Julia es que en un futuro su negocio se dedique a la venta al por mayor de animales y así sacar adelante a su familia en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia, 36, is a mother living in her own house with her husband and children.  The house only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Panga District, 20 minutes from Chepén Province which belongs to La Libertad Department.  This zone is characterized by residents who are animal merchants and farmers.

Since five years ago, Julia has been buying, raising and selling barnyard fowl (turkeys, chickens and roosters) and pigs.  Her corrals are located a few minutes from home.  She feeds her animals a nutritionally balanced diet and natural grains.  Once they reach ideal development she sells them to area residents and also sells them in the Chepén market which allows her to increase profits to meet daily household needs.

Because of this, Julia has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more pigs and nutritionally balanced feed.  Both of these things will help her animal sales to increase permitting her to repay the loan and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Patrick I.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you workers of the Ministry of Social Welfare, from Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers and workers of various institutions usually apply for loans from SMT/Kiva lenders. At the end of each month, the bursar or person in charge of paying salaries at the institution will deduct the borrowers’ monthly repayments and pay SMT on their behalf. 

This is the first loan that workers from this institution have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 4,500,000 to help them buy or invest in something that they are unable to afford solely with their salaries.

Patrick, 46 years old, is the leader of the group. He was born in the village of Mange Bureh. He is married and has 3 children who attend primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Patrick has requested a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy house building materials.

loans.use: to buy house building materials

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es una madre de familia de  31 años de edad, vive con sus   hijos, tiene casa propia la cual cuenta con el  servicio sólo luz, ubicado en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura aproximadamente.  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola, ganadera y artesanía que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Eulalia a colocado en la parte de adelante de su casa su tienda donde productos de primera necesidad  (papel higiénico, huevos, aceite, leche, lejía, detergente y todo tipo de golosinas, etc.), con el negocio que tiene en su domicilio trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia, ya que han incrementado sus ventas.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda con más mercadería para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementar  sus ingresos para su hogar.  Eulalia es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo,  trabajo dedicación.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 31, is a mother living with her children.  She owns her house which only has electricity located in an urban part of Tambogrande District about 40 minutes from Piura Department.  These zones are noted for the high levels of commercial activity, farming, livestock raising and crafts that their residents engage in.

Eulalia has installed a grocery store in the front part of her house.  She stocks basic need items (toilet paper, eggs, oil, milk, lye, detergent and all sorts of snacks, etc.)  Through her home-based business she strives to provide a better standard of living for her family.

Since her sales have increased she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to stock her store with more merchandise to continue meeting customer demand and at the same time increase income for her home.

Eulalia is known by her neighbors for being a cheerful woman always willing to help others and for being a responsible mother whose only objective is that they succeed as a family thanks to their effort, work and dedication.

loans.use: to stock her store with more merchandise.

loans.name: Marisela Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Marisela tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 5 años, la experiencia que ha obtenido en su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Marisela tiene 1 hija de 5 años a su cargo, siempre se ha hecho responsable por proporcionarle las cosas más básicas, a pesar de que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios quiere que su hija logra ser una profesional. Este crédito es para la compra de  perfumes, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en: Young Marisela has run a business selling general merchandise for more than five years.  The experience she has gained has been very reassuring.  The majority of her clients always ask for a variety of products.  Marisela has one five-year-old daughter in her care.  She has always been responsible providing her with basic necessities.  Even though Marisela was not able to finish school, she would like for her daughter to become a professional.  This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, shoes, general clothing, cosmetics, and bed linens, among other things.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, shoes, clothes, cosmetics, linens, etc.

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es:
Walberto de 41 años, es soltero, tiene casa propia que cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, se encuentra ubicado en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por que la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Walberto se dedica a la comercialización de arroz en cáscara, es un mercado que tiene mucha competencia pero también es amplio, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animlaes (aves de corral como cabras), losingresos de ambas actividades le permite solventar sus gastos personles.

Al ver que su negocio va incrementando sus ventas a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1800 nuevos soles para seguir comprando arroz en cáscara y comercializarlo, ésto le ayudará a tener más ganacias para cubrir su crédito como para  tener un mejor nivel de vida.   Walberto es un cliente antiguo para la empresa y a demostrado ser un cliente fiel y muy responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Walberto, 41, is single.  He owns his house that has water and electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Lambayeque Department.  This zone is characterized by the activities its residents engage in: farming, raising livestock and tourism.

Walberto has been selling unhulled rice for several years.  It’s a market with much competition but also a wide one.  He also raises barnyard fowl and goats to sell.  Income from both activities makes it possible for him to meet personal expenses.

Seeing that his business is growing, he’s though it convenient to request an 1800 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to continue buying unhulled rice to sell.  This will help him earn higher profits to repay the loan and to have a better standard of living.

Walberto is a longstanding client of the firm and has shown himself to be a faithful, very responsible client with respect to his payments.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of unhulled rice.

loans.name: Erodion

texts.es: Erodion, de 32 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri departamento de Cusco, convive con Alicia de 30 años, ambos tienen 03 hijos, quienes son la felicidad de su hogar y juntos viven en su propia casa, en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Baja caserío del distrito de Quimbiri. Erodion, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva café, cacao y frutas de piña. Durante 10 años ha trabajado en esta actividad y es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el agro; pero en tiempos de cosecha busca contrata jornaleros para que le ayuden en la extracción de los frutos. La producción de sus frutos es rentable, en este caso la piña y el café, por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los gránulos de cada uno de sus cultivos. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras ya que no cuenta con espacios para seguir sembrando. Este es su sexto crédito de Erodion con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con el crédito solicitado comprará árboles maderables como caoba, cedro y tornillo para cercar los perímetros de su parcela y con el tiempo pueda aserrar troncos en gran volumen.
texts.en:
Erodión, 32, is from the city of Quimbiri, Cusco Department.  He lives with Alicia, 30, and they have three children who are the joy of their home.  They all live together in their own home.

In the community of Vista Alegre Baja in Quimbiri District, Erodión works very hard as a farmer.  He has a three hectare field where he grows coffee, cocoa beans and pineapples.  He has been in this occupation for 10 years so he is very aware of how hard farming can be.  During harvest time he hires day laborers to help him pick the fruit.  Fruit production, in this case coffee and pineapple, is profitable because the crop consolidators pay him good prices for each kilogram. The problem in his work consists in being unable to combat the insects that damage the buds of his crops.  For now, though, his main priority is buying new land because he lacks space to continue planting.

This is Erodión’s sixth loan with MFP.  He is determined to repay all his installments punctually because he hopes to access a future loan later.  He is a very participative member of his communal bank.

He will use the requested loan to buy hardwood trees like mahogany, cedar and tornillo, to use as fencing around the perimeter of his field and in time be able to saw large volumes of lumber from the trunks.

loans.use: to buy hardwood trees.

loans.name: Abdul A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Wandor Islamic Secondary School in Blama, near Kenema city. This school was founded in 1985 by the National Islamic Mission in Kenama to improve the educational standard of children in the community. This school is currently staffed with 13 teachers and has an enrollment of 510 pupils.

This is the first time that teachers of the Wandor Islamic Secondary School will benefit from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 6,500,000 to buy or invest in something that they cannot afford with their salaries.

Abdul A. is the leader of the group. He was born in the small town of Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. Abdul is 47 years old, married and has 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. He has been a teacher for 22 years. He is going to use his share of the loan to buy house building materials such as cement, corrugated iron rods, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as cement, corrugated iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela Maria de 41 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Ella tiene 1 hijo con el que sueña ver prósperos y productivos y por eso se esmera por lograr una educación de calidad y es precisamente su mayor motivación en el trabajo que desempeña como comerciante. Ángela inició su negocio con capital propio, pues con ciertos ahorros que tenía decide comenzar a comprar ciertos productos para empezar a ofrecer a todo público en general. La competencia de su mercado es muy fuerte y para ella este es su mayor desafío, pero como maneja muy bien sus relaciones con los proveedores, logra precios que traslada a sus clientes, con los cuales los mantiene fieles. Este crédito es para la compra de  cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, lápiz labial, brillos, lápiz de ojos entre otras.
texts.en:
Ángela María, 41, sells cosmetics.  She has a son that she hopes to see prosperous and productive and this is why she strives to give him a quality education and precisely why it’s her greatest motivation to work as a merchant.

Ángela started her business with her own capital, certain saving she had.  She decided to buy certain products to start selling to the general public.

Her market competition is quite strong and this is her greatest challenge.  However, because she maintains very good relationships with her suppliers, she gets good prices that she passes on to her customers which keeps them faithful to her.

This loan is to buy creams, hair treatments, shampoo, lipstick, nail polish, eyeliner, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Yamerson

texts.es: Yamerson, de 22 años, es un joven soltero y sobre todo muy entusiasta en sus labores, vive en  casa de sus padres. Yamerson a su corta edad es un joven con múltiples necesidades, es por ello que se esmera en trabajar arduamente en sus campos de cultivo donde siembra variedad de plantas tropicales como: cacao, café, y frutas de piña, los cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus productos no dudan en ir al encuentro para comprarle todos sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir la plaga que se apoderan de los primeros brotes de sus plantas. Por tal desea exterminarlos de manera natural colocando trampas y cortinas de mayas para no dañar el medio ambiente. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas muy fructíferas.
texts.en:
Yamerson, 22, is a young single man who is very enthusiastic about his work.  He lives with his parents.  At his young age he has many needs so he strives to work hard in his fields where he grows a variety of tropical plants like: cocoa beans, coffee and pineapple which, once harvested, he takes to the city of San Francisco, where he already has buyers who know about the quality of his products and don’t hesitate to buy all of his crops, to sell.

What he enjoys the most about his work is planting his fields to make them fertile and productive.  He’s been in this occupation for three years and considers the most difficult part of it to be combating the infestations that invade his budding plants.  Because of this he hopes to exterminate them using natural methods like setting traps and placing netting so as not to damage the environment.  In the future he hopes to continue saving his income because he wants to buy new land.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He knows that this contribution will be very beneficial for his work’s development.  He feels happy to belong to the group of members of his communal bank.

He will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure to fertilize his fields and make them more bountiful.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
la joven Ana Rosa tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la colonia Carranza de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de lacteos desde hace mas de 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal municipal de buses de Choluteca. Ana tiene muchos clientes ya que por este lugar transitan muchas personas.
Ana es madre soltera y vive con sus hijos en la casa de sus padres.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visistar a su familia. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de queso, quesillo, cuajada y mantequilla, ahora las ventas son mayores y muchas veces se queda sin producto.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa, 30, lives in the city of Choluteca’s Carranza neighborhood.  She has sold dairy products for over 4 years.  Her business is located in the Choluteca Municipal Bus Terminal.  Ana has many customers because there are many passersby in this place.  She is a single mother living with her children in her parents’ house.  She uses her free time to visit her family.

She will use the loan to buy cheese, cottage cheese, soft cheese and butter now that sales have increased and often she’s left without any product.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cottage cheese, soft cheese and butter.

loans.name: Sergio Sebastian

texts.es: El señor Sergio de 33 años, es casado y cuenta con la venta de ropa y zapatos, pues tiene su negocio de manera ambulante y en su vivienda.  Empezó este negocio con capital propio a pesar de que no eran muchos productos, pudo agrandar un poco su inventario, es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento que es para la compra de  pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, camisetas, zapatillas, sandalias, deportivos y más. Se siente muy agradecido con Fundación por la confianza otorgada y comenta que con la mercadería nueva estaría cumpliendo mejor con su numerosa clientela.
texts.en: Sergio is 33 years old and married. He sells clothing and shoes from home and as a street vendor. He started his business with his own money even though he wasn't able to offer many products. This loan will allow Sergio to increase his inventory. He plans to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, t-shirts, shoes, sandals, sportswear, etc. Sergio is very grateful to the Foundation for trusting him with this loan. He says that his new merchandise will help him to better serve all his customers.

loans.use: buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, t-shirts, shoes, sandals, sportswear, etc.

loans.name: G.s. Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es: La señora Teresa Del Carmen es originaria de La Concepción, su negocio es una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación. La señora aduce que considera un éxito el que con las ganancias ha podido comprar sus electrodomésticos para su comodidad y además ha podido mantener su capital. Su principal problema han sido las enfermedades familiares. En su zona no tiene mucha competencia ya que no hay muchas pulperías cercanas. Desea invertir en  su negocio con productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, galletas, detergentes, enlatados y sopas.
texts.en: Señora Teresa Del Carmen is a native of La Concepción.  She runs a general store located in her house.  She considers her store a success as she has been able to purchase appliances for her convenience and also maintain her capital.  Her main problem has been family sicknesses.  There isn't much competition in her area since there aren't many general stores here.  She wants to invest in her business buy purchasing products such as basic grains, candy, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, canned goods and soups.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, canned goods and soups.

loans.name: Reyna Argentina

texts.es:
doña Reyna Argentina es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos, su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de buses de Choluteca, este lugar es muy estrategico ya que todo el dia viajan muchas personas y aprovechan a comer en el negocio de la sra. Reyna, en estos momentos las ventas son muy buenas y no se da abasto para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los alimentos para la preparacion de sus golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos.
Reyna es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, Reyna se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y luego atender a sus clientes.
en sus tiempos libres se dedica la cria de gallinas y cerdos.
texts.en: Doña Reyna Argentina is a hard-working woman who runs a business selling sweets, breakfasts and lunches.  Her business is located in the bus terminal in Choluteca.  This is a very strategic location since many people travel through here all day long and eat at Señora Reyna's.  Currently, her sales are very good and she can't keep up with the demand.  She will use the loan to buy food supplies to prepare her sweets, breakfasts and lunches.  Reyna is a single mother with 5 children.  She gets up at 5:00 every morning to prepare her foods and then she attends to her customers.  In her free time she raises hens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, lard, oil, rice, vegetables, beans, cheese, butter, soft drinks, salt, spices, bread, juice, chorizo and eggs.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: Yuri, de 45 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Quimbiri, está casado con Francisca de 43 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 06 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Baja anexo del distrito de Quimbiri. La labor que realiza Yuri es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de café, cacao y frutos de piña, en total tiene 03 hectáreas de terreno y es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo agrícola; donde viene trabajando 23 años en sus propias tierras. Pero en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros que contrata para se encarguen de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con vehículos menores. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos y precipitaciones de lluvia así perjudicando sus campos florales. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro crédito con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal donde es muy estimado por el resto de los integrantes. Con el crédito solicitado comprará  más semillas de piña, ya que es uno de sus cultivos con mayor demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Yuri, 45, is from Quimbiri District.  He’s married to Francisca, 43, and they have six children.  They live together in their own house located in the community of Vista Alegre Bajo, an annex of Quimbiri District.  He has 3 hectares of land where he farms coffee, cocoa beans and pineapple.  He is well aware of how hard faming is for he has been working his land for 23 years.  However, during harvests he hires day laborers to help him gather the crops and transport them in small trucks.  

He is very committed to his work because thanks to his daily effort, today he enjoys seeing his plants bear fruit thus obtaining good profits.  He relates that winter isn’t much to his liking because those are the months when his flower crops are damaged by the large numbers of insects that abound and by the rainfall.

This is his 6th loan with MFP.  He knows that if he repays it on time he will be able to access another loan more easily and not cause complications for his communal bank where he is held in high esteem by the other members.

He will use the requested loan to buy pineapple seeds since that’s one the the products with the highest market demand.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seeds.

loans.name: Narsiza

texts.es:
Narsiza tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y vive en una comunidad rural con muchos deseos de desarrollo, ubicada en el distrito de Túcume en Lambayeque. 

Narsiza se dedica desde hace 8 años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (patos, pavos y gallinas) en su domicilio. Los pobladores de su zona se han convertido en clientela ya establecida para Narsiza. Ellos saben de la buena crianza que Narsiza les da a sus animales es por eso que la prefieren a ella antes que a otros.

Narsiza solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de más aves, de alimento balanceado para estas y de mejoras en el corral donde las cría.

Narsiza es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, es un cliente antiguo para nuestra entidad que canceló adecuadamente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Narsiza is 49 years of age, married and lives in a developing rural community located in the district of Túcume in Lambayeque. 

Narsiza has raised and sold poultry such as ducks, turkeys and chickens in her home for the last eight years. Her community have become an established customer base for Narsiza, as they know that she treats her animals well and this is why they prefer to buy from her than anyone else. 

Narsiza is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to purchase more birds, provide them with a balanced diet and improve their pen.

Narsiza is hardworking, responsible, and a long standing client with Edpyme Alternative who has paid for her previous loan installments in full.

loans.use: to purchase birds, provide them with a balanced diet and improve their pen.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es una mujer trabajadora de 40 años de edad, ella está casada y vive junto a su esposo en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque.

Lucinda tiene una tienda en su domicilio desde hace 10 años, en ella vende abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, aceite), golosinas y bebidas (agua, gaseosas). Es decir tiene una tienda surtida que cuenta con clientes fijos debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece.

Lucinda desea obtener más ganancias para poder ahorrar y así mejorar su calidad de vida es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para seguir surtiendo su negocio.

Lucinda tiene muchas metas que cumplir y este crédito le sería de gran utilidad. Ella es un cliente antiguo para nuestra entidad y ha cancelado correctamente sus préstamos anteriores.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a hardworking woman of 40 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband in the rural district of Túcume in Lambayeque.

Lucinda has run a grocery store from her home for the last 10 years, selling groceries such as sugar, rice and oil, sweets, water and soft drinks. Her store is stocked to cater for her regular customers who come to her for the variety of products on offer. 

Lucinda would like to increase her income so she can save more and improve her quality of life, which is why she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles. She will use this money to purchase more products to keep her store well stocked. 

Lucinda has many goals she would like to accomplish so this loan will be very useful for her. She is a long standing client with Edpyme Alternativa and she has paid for her previous loans in full.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, sweets and drinks to keep her store well stocked.

loans.name: Ada Ismelda

texts.es:
Doña Ada Ismelda es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de refrescos y jugos, su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de buses de Choluteca, tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, muchas personas le compran sus refrescos y jugos ya que esta ciudad es una de las mas calientes de Honduras y las personas buscan tomar algo para refrescarse.  
Ada es madre  soltera, tiene una hija.
Ada todos los dias se levanta temprano para ir a abrir su negocio y atender a sus clientes, ya que los horarios de viajes de los buses comienzan desde las 4:00am.
Ada en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
texts.en: Dona Ada Ismelda is a hardworking young woman who sells soda and juice. Her business is located in the Choluteca bus terminal. Ada has been in this line of work for four years now. Her city is one of the hottest in Honduras, so she has plenty of customers. People there are always looking for a way to keep cool. Ada is a single mother. She has one daughter. The buses at the terminal start running at 4:00 AM, so Ada wakes up early every day to open her shop and serve her customers. When she has free time, she often goes to church.

loans.use: buy soda and juice.

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar es uno de los agricultores más conocidos de Pilas de Pérez Zeledón, el es parte de la asociación de productores de maíz y frijoles.
En este momento la demanda está muy fuerte, porque la producción de granos básicos es rentable en la comunidad, es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de  ₡350 000 (trescientos cincuenta mil colones)  para la compra de abonos  e insecticidas y demás insumos agrícolas que necesita para asegurar la calidad de su producción. 
El  es  socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Oldemar is one of the better known farmers in Pilas, Pérez Zeledón.  He is part of the corn and bean producers association.
