Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Idilia is a member of the Communal Bank “El Progresso” which is in the community of Independencia in the city of Santiago. She is a merchant who sells candy and beverages from a street cart, Monday through Friday. Idilia also sells jewelry from her home and on Sundays she sells olives. Saturdays are designated for buying merchandise to stock her candy business. She buys her merchandise at the central market in the city of Santiago since the prices are the most affordable.

Idilia has been in business for 20 years. She started out selling olives and condiments. This loan will be used to buy a cooler, merchandise to restock her business, and an awning for protection from the rain since the one she currently uses is in bad condition.

Her goals include selling her products from an established location, such as a kiosk, but she first needs to obtain a permit. She also hopes that her business will prosper by adding handicrafts made of clay to her inventory. Idilia is motivated to continue with her business and include new products. The income she earns enables her to cover her household expenses. She lives with her daughter, son-in-law, and three grandchildren. Her goals on a personal level are to achieve a more stable socioeconomic situation and to live a more comfortable life.

Idilia is very grateful for the loan provided by Fondo Esperanza because the funds allow her to invest in her business and generate more income. She says the Communal Bank meetings are very pleasant and have enabled her to form friendships with the other group members. Idilia also has incorporated into her business the sales techniques she learned from the meetings. She also tracks her expenses, income, and the quoted prices of her purchases.

Independencia is one of the 34 communities that make of the city of Santiago, the Chilean capital. It is located in the north-central section. Independencia emerged in the late nineteenth century as a traditional section of the city. The main street is Independencia Avenue, which crosses the old Inca Trail, the gateway to the north in the city of Santiago. Given its large indigenous population, Independencia is known as the “Indigenous Cultural Center” of Chile. There are also important historical buildings, including six Chilean landmarks.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, merchandise for her business, and an awning to protect her food cart from the rain.

loans.name: Liduvinda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liduvinda de 31 años, es casada pero todavía no tiene hijos, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo, la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos a una hora del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

El esposo de  Lidivuinda  labora manejando su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito y a los caseríos cercanos.  Ambas actividades le permite tener más ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios. 

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindarle mantenimiento y cambiar algunos repuestos de sumototaxi,para seguir brindando un servicio de calidad, seguridad y comdidad a sus clientes.  Liduvinda tiene como meta en un futuro poder comprar otra mototaxi para alquilarla y tener mejores ingresos económicos, para poder cubrir su crédito y desea que su negocio crezca cada vez más para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liduvinda, 31, is married but doesn't have any children yet.  She lives with her husband in their own house, but the house doesn't have basic services.  They live in the rural area of Olmos, an hour from Lambayeque department where the people work in agriculture and cattle raising.

Liduvinda's husband has driven a mototaxi (a means of transportation to move people short distances with a maximum load of 3 passangers) for some years in the same district and in nearby villages.  This allows them to have more income to cover expenses.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 new sols for vehicle maintenance and to change some parts in the sumototaxi so that he can continue giving quality service, safety, and comfort to his customers.  Liduvinda's goal for the future is to buy another mototaxi to rent and to have increased earnings to cover the loan.  She also wants her business to grow even more so that they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to have maintenance and to change out some spare parts on the mototaxi.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos (3 independientes).  Justina cuenta con estudios en educación primaria (incompleta).
Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos,  desD. hace un ciclo.  Su  préstamo  inicial  fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra y venta D. ganados como ovino y vacuno.
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementará al capital D. su negocio para comprar una vaca, en el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo, quien también trabaja en la pesca. 
Su sueño es tener más ganados y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la reunión done comparte con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Communal Bank “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II” (Sisters of Choquetanca II) which is in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children (three of whom are independent). Justina did not finish her elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and invested in her business of buying selling livestock, such as sheep and cattle.

Justina is currently requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN. The money will increase her business capital so that she can purchase a cow. In her business she works with her husband, who also has a job as a fisherman. Her dreams incluD. having more livestock and improving her income.

What she enjoys about the Communal Bank are the meetings where she gets to share with the other members.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Libia Esther

texts.es: Libia es la propietaria de "Confecciones Libia", negocio que  inició cuando hace dos años, decidió ser independiente,  después de haber trabajado con una empresa de confecciones durante 28 años, ella misma realiza toda la producción a excepción de las temporadas altas, en las cuales contrata un personal para responder a la demanda de su mercado; cuenta con una clientela fija y exclusiva,  localizada   en Soledad y en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vende ropa sobre medidas, ella compra las materias primas e insumos a sus proveedores de contado y con una frecuencia semanal. Su negocio cubre todos los costos y tiene otra fuente de ingreso familiar, proporcionado por el negocio de mercancías que tiene su esposo y esto  le proporciona mayor estabilidad, su índices de liquidez son buenos y por eso planea contraer una obligación a corto plazo, la calidad de su trabajo y su cumplimiento han contribuido a mantenerla en el mercado , su propósito al acceder a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la línea credikiva es cumplir con pedidos a propósito de la temporada que se avecina,  que para las Libia es muy buena y ya tiene pedidos. Con este fin invertirá en materias primas e insumos para fabricar camisetas, pantalones, vestidos, cubrelechos cortinas y bolsos, mercancía que ya está encargada y augura una rotación inmediata del producto terminado. Libia vive en el barrio Soledad 2000 con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 24 y 27 años, a quienes sueña con ver prósperos y exitosos; en este barrio es muy usual que busquen en el negocio de libia resolver las necesidades del buen vestir, porque allí se ha posicionado como una buena confeccionista.
texts.en:
Libia is the owner of "Confecciones Libia" (Libia’s Handicrafts), a business she began when, two years ago, she decided to go into business for herself after having worked for 28 years for a sewing business. She carries out all the production herself, except in the high season when she hires personnel to meet the demands of her market. She has an established and exclusive clientele located in Soledad and in the center of the city of Baranquilla, where she sells custom made clothing.

Libia buys her raw materials from her suppliers in cash on a weekly basis. Her business covers all costs, and she has another source of family income provided by merchandise sold by her husband’s business. Her liquidity is good, and that’s why she plans to undertake a short-term obligation. The quality of her work and her fulfillment of orders have contributed to the establishment of her business.

She is undertaking her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The function of this line of Kiva credit will be to fill orders for the upcoming season. She already has orders, and these are very good. To this end she will invest in raw materials for making t-shirts, pants, dresses, bed spreads, curtains, and bags, merchandise that is already ordered and foreshadows an immediate need for finished products.

Libia lives in the Soledad 2000 neighborhood with her husband and two children, ages 24 and 27, whom she dreams of seeing prosperous and successful. In this neighborhood, it is very common to see people seek out Libia’s business to obtain the necessities for being well-dressed because she has positioned herself as a good seamstress.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for making t-shirts, pants, dresses, bedspreads, curtains, and bags.

loans.name: Elvira Sonia

texts.es:
Elvira  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.  La señora estudió  educación superior (incompleta).
Hace ocho años que trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su   préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio al cual se dedicaba anteriormente (venta al por menor de artículos artesanales), en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, chocolates y golosinas.

Elvira nos cuenta que también realiza el servicio de recargas de celulares.  La señora trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una tienda y ser mayorista  en abarrotes y golosinas en la localidad de Juliaca.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer," located in the Juli district of Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is a 30 year-old widow who has 2 school-aged children.  Elvira has completed some college coursework.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 8 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, money that she used as capital for her previous business selling handicrafts.  Now she has a business selling groceries.  She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, chocolates and candies.

Elvira tells us that she is also in the business of selling cellular telephone minutes.  She works alone in her business.  Her dream is to have a store and be a wholesaler of groceries and candy in the town of Juliaca.  

What she likes about her communal bank is the earnings she gets on her savings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, chocolates and candy

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”,  ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.  La señora tiene estudios superiores.
Ana nos cuenta que tiene una tienda en el mercado de la zona donde vende abarrotes y artículos de plásticos.  Hace cuatro años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su   préstamo inicial fue  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 350.00 nuevo soles, comprará 200 bolsas de caramelos y otras golosinas.  Su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es terminar  con la construcción de su casa.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (new dawn), located in the district of Juli, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 31 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of two school-aged children. She studied up to higher education.

Ana says that she has a store at the local market, where she sells groceries and plastic items. She has worked for four years with the microfinance institution Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her initial loan amounted to 300 new soles, which she used to increase her working capital. She will use this new loan of 350 new soles to buy 200 bags of candy and other goodies.

Her husband is a teacher. Her dream is to finish the construction of their home. What she likes about her communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy 200 bags of candy and other goodies.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a la venta de animales, en donde los alimenta en un tiempo determinado hasta alcanzar el peso que necesita para ser vendidos. Por tanto siempre cuida de u alimentación así como de su aseo, ya que tiene que limpiar cada cierto tiempo su establo. Para ella es muy importante estos cuidados por que sino podría sufrir perdidas de sus animales y eso le da desventaja en el negocio. Al margen de su actividad, no descuida su hogar ni sus hijos. Ella pide su ayuda para que pueda intensificarse en la ganadería y así obtener una estabilidad económica. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, considera que los consejos que le dan su grupo comunal le han enseñado a ser mas prudente en sus gastos, y por tal esta agradecida por la confianza que le han dado. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en compra de carneros.
texts.en: Haydee is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and son in her parents' house. For more than two years, she has been dedicated to selling animals, for which she feeds them for a set time until they reach the weight required to be sold. So she always takes care of feeding and cleaning them since she has to clean the barn from time to time. For her, this care is very important since without it she could suffer losses of animals and this would be a disadvantage for her business. Besides this work, she does not neglect her home or her children. She is requesting your help so she may expand her livestock and obtain economic stability. This is her second loan with MFP. She considers that the tips that her community group have given her have taught her to be more prudent in her expenses and she is thankful for the confidence they have given her. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of rams.

loans.use: to purchase more rams.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pedro, es originario de la comarca el Coyolito, ubicada en la Concordia municipio de Jinotega , es casado , tiene 3 hijos, de oficio agricultor siembra hortalizas, con un nivel académico hasta 4 grado de primaria. Inicio con ayuda de su papa quien lo ha apoyado desde siempre, su primer negocio fue a los 16 años de edad era músico, animaba fiestas ,cumpleaños , a los 18 años aprendió el oficio de zapatero siempre en busca de sustento alimenticio al mismo tiempo sembrando hortalizas , a los 20 años se caso y se dedico de lleno a la siembra de hortalizas , le gustaría expandir su producto en el mercado de Jinotega y Managua.
Solicito el préstamo para mantenimiento de 4 manzanas de frijoles ¾ de chiltoma ,compra  de insumos , pago de mano de obra. Este crédito le ayudara al establecimiento de cultivos , en especial ¾ de manzanas de siembras de chiltoma así como también  mejorar sus ingresos . Su próxima meta es realizar la siembra de 4 manzanas de frijoles.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro is originally from the Coyolito district, located in the Concordia town of Jinotega. He is married and has three children. He works in agriculture, growing vegetables. He attended school up to the 4th grade of primary school. He started out with the help of his father, who has always supported him. His first business was in music, when he was 16 years old. He entertained at parties and birthdays. At the age of 18 he learned the shoemaking trade, at the same time planting vegetables, always in search of nourishing sustenance. At 20, he married and dedicated himself completely to growing vegetables. He would like to expand his products to the markets of Jinotega and Managua.

He applied for the loan so that he can maintain 4 manzanas of beans (a manzana is about 1.75 acres) and 3/4 manzana of sweet peppers, buy supplies, and pay for labor. This loan will help him establish his fields, particularly the 3/4 manzana he will plant with peppers, and will thus also improve his income. His next goal is to plant the 4 manzanas of beans.

loans.use: to maintain his fields of beans and peppers, buy supplies, and pay for labor

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos (1 independiente), la señora estudio  hasta 1ro de educación secundaria.
Candelaria trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años,  su  préstamo inicial de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanías, como bordados.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos kilos de lana matizados de diferentes colores y otros insumos para la elaboración de sus tejidos.  Trabaja sola en el negocio.
Su sueño es tener su propia tienda de artesanía y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (new dawn), located in the district of Juli, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 42 years old, single and the mother of four children (one lives on his own). She studied up to first grade in secondary education.

Candelaria has worked for five years with the microfinance institution Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her initial loan amounted to 300 new soles, which she invested in her handicraft (such as embroidery) business. She will use this new loan of 500 new soles to buy 2 kilograms of blended wool of different colors and other material to produce knitted fabric. She works alone in her business. Her dream is to have her own handicraft store and increase her income.

What she likes about her communal bank is the ease of the loan granting process and the possibility to save money.

loans.use: to buy 2 kilograms of blended wool of different colors.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es: Elvia tiene dos hijos en las edades D. 30 a 35 años y vive en el barrio San Salvador, donD. se desempeña como comerciante. Negocio que indicó en el año 1975 inició su experiencia D. emprendimiento vendiendo mercancía que traía desD. D. Maicao, municipio fronterizo con Venezuela, para comercializarla entre empleados D. almacenes , comisariatos;  ella distribuida entre su clientela blusas, suéteres y sabanas principalmente, luego adicionó perfumes, electrodomésticos menores y aumentó sus ganancias, las cuales invirtió en prendas D. oro, pero en este último negocio no le fue muy bien , así que decidió conseguir en la ciudad D. Medellín, productos D. buena calidad que confeccionan en esa ciudad, y se inclinó por los juanes y la ropa deportiva con la que sacó adelante su inversión;  así mismo fue a Bucaramanga, donD. fabrican muy buenos productos en cuero e inició comprando  calzado y bolsos en cuero y adicionó  ropa infantil; ella todo el tiempo se ha movido en este mercado porque como madre cabeza D. familia, decidió trabajar fuertemente para lograr el bienestar D. sus hijos; hoy como producto D. su trabajo  tiene su casa propia y dos apartamentos arrendados, que le generan otros ingresos y sus hijos son profesionales . Los proveedores la conocen como un cliente muy responsable y por esta misma apreciación ha ganado muchos clientes  fijos y rentables, que le refieren nuevos clientes. Su sueño es seguir creciendo para disfrutar la tercera edad y no tener dependencia económica, en esta etapa. Este es su crédito # 15 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  el comprará perfumes, sabanas, electrodomésticos modernos, para continuar fortaleciendo su capital D. trabajo y aumentar su rentabilidad que es no menor del 14%.
texts.en:
Elvia has two children aged 30 and 35, and lives in San Salvador neighborhood where she works as a trader.  She started her business in 1975 and at first she sold merchandise that she transported from Maicao (a town on the border with Venezuela) to sell to people working in stores and co-ops.  She mainly sold her customers blouses, sweaters and sheets and then added perfumes and small electrical appliances.  She increased her profits and invested them in gold jewelry.  However, the jewelry business did not do very well so she decided to buy good-quality products from the city of Medellín that are maD. in that city.  She mainly bought jeans and sports clothes and moved forward in her investment.  She also traveled to Bucaramanga where they make very good leather products and started buying leather footwear and bags.  She then added children's clothing.  Elvia has always moved in this market because, as a mother and head of household, she decided to work hard in order to support her children.  Today, as a result of her work, she owns her own home, as well as two rental apartments which make her additional income, and her children are professionals.

Elvia's suppliers know her to be a very responsible customer and, for this same reason, she has gained many regular and profitable customers herself who refer new customers to her.  Her dream is to continue growing in her business so that she can enjoy her old age and not be financially dependent during that stage of her life.

This is Elvia's 15th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy perfumes, sheets and modern electrical appliances so that she can continue strengthening her working capital and increase her profitability which is not less than 14%.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, sheets and modern electrical appliances

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El señor  es conviviente con la señora Elizabeth hace 2 años atrás, tienen un hijo dependiente de un año, saben leer y escribir, la familia vive en la comunidad de Palta Loma sindicato Huancuni hacia el norte de Colomi más de 2 años.                                                                                                                                                                                                
Su actividad económica es la producción agrícola, lo cual ellos nos cuentan que acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad de Cochabamba les queda muy lejos además les pidieron muchos requisitos, razón por la que se tuvo la oportunidad de otorgarles un crédito para lo que ellos necesitaban para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa más productos agroquímicos.
                                                                                               
Por último el señor y su esposa nos cuentan que con este dinero van a cultivar en más superficie ya que este año tuvieron un ingreso económico bueno, así para el siguiente año ya tener una vida mejor que ahora en bien de su familia.
texts.en:
This man has lived with his partner, Elizabeth, for two years. They have a one-year-old son. They know how to read and write. The family has lived in the community of Palta Loma, Huancuni union to the north of Colomi for more than two years. His economic activity is agricultural production. They tell us that going to the banks in the city of Cochabamba is too far and they ask for many requirements, which is the reason why the opportunity was taken to grant a loan for what they need to purchase organic fertilizer, potato seed, and more agrichemical products.

Finally, this man and his wife tell us that with this money, they are going to cultivate more land, since this year they had good economic income, so that next year they will have a better life for the sake of their family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
El señor  Panfilo, tiene 19 años de edad, recientemente se a casado, viven en la comunidad de Uchama baja del municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba.
Trabaja en la agricultura, produce  papa, mani y frejol; y los comercializa en el mismo lugar. Es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de su nuevo hogar.
Esta solicitando el presente crédito para comprar mas semillas e insumos y aumentar mas superficie de sus cultivos y asi aumentar sus ingresos, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Panfilo is 19 years old. He has recently got married and he lives in Uchama, a community of the municipality of Mizque located in the Cochabamba department.
He engages in agriculture, producing potatoes, peanuts and beans, and he sells his products in his own community. He is a well-respected member of his community, both for being dedicated to his job and for being in charge of his new family.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more seeds and materials in order to increase the extension of his lands, consequently increasing his earnings and improving the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and materials.

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es:
L. señora Ruth  tiene 48 años D. edad y vive en una casa D. propiedad D. sus padres junto a sus hijos. Vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio L. Pampa D. L. ciudad D. Tarija. Ruth es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos D. 20 y 15 años D. edad, Ruth desD. hace varios años se dedica al comercio su puesto D. venta D. alimentos, galletas refrescos y otros, este puesto se encuentra dentro D. L. universidad D. odontologia. Por circunstancia D. L. vida se quedo soL.. Ahora Ruth tiene que trabajar soL. para poder sacar  adelante a sus hijos que uno D. ellos ya esta en L. universidad. Ruth desD. hace  22 años que tiene su negocio en L. universidad. Es una persona muy conocida por los docentes y estudiantes que consumen sus productos, ahora Ruth quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero elL. nos cuenta que tiene L. necesidad D. comprar un horno industrial y mercadería.  D. esa forma poder  surtir mas su puesto D. venta.  Como elL. ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado para L. compra D. dicho horno y mercadería que es necesario para realizar su actividad para D. ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Ruth nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones D. vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones D. L. casa donD. vive.
texts.en:
Ruth is 48 years old and lives together with her children in a house that belongs to her parents.  The house is located in L. Pampa neighborhood, in the city of Tarija.  Ruth is single but she has two children aged 20 and 15.  For several years, she has had a sales location where she sells food, cookies, soft drinks, etc which is located in the University of Dentistry.  Through life's circumstances, Ruth was left on her own.  Now she has to work on her own in order to get her children ahead in life.  One of them is already attending university.

Ruth has had her business at the university for 22 years.  She is very well known by the professors and students who eat her products.  Ruth would now like to make better income in order to get ahead in life but she tells us that she needs to buy an industrial stove and merchandise with which to better stock her sales location.  As she already has experience in this field, her loan will be used to buy the stove and merchandise that she needs to carry out her business so that she can increase her income.  Ruth tells us that she would like to improve her living conditions.  She says that she will therefore request her next loan to improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 56 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a s querido hijo Héctor de 56 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Aunque tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven, Ana no dejó que las necesidades de dinero que tenía la venzan. Es así que logró juntar un poco de dinero y poner su propio negocio de venta de tamales, ahora tiene muchos clientes, ya que sus deliciosos tamales, son muy solicitados y consumidos, en su distrito Villa el Salvador. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, ella se esmera mucho en complacerlos. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el ardiente sol todos los días. Para un futuro cercano, espera poder comprar un carrito, donde pueda trasladar sus cosas con mayor facilidad. Este es el octavo  crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesta apagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, ya que es muy puntual. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos tamales.
texts.en: Ana is 56 years old. She is a very simple and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house. She is willing to work very hard for it.  Although she has worked since she was very young, she didn’t let the need for money defeat her. She took a little bit of money and started her own business, selling tamales. She has lots of customers since her tamales are delicious and they are often requested and eaten in her district, Villa el Salvador. What she likes most about her work is serving her customers. She tries very hard to please them. She has had this business for 30 years and she considers working under the burning sun every day the hardest part of the job. In the near future, she hopes to buy a little cart in order to carry her materials more easily. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the loan and she is determined to make her payments on time. In her communal bank, she is a well-respected member since she is very punctual. With the requested loan, she will buy more ingredients in order to prepare her delicious tamales.

loans.use: buy ingredients in order to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Bianca

texts.es:
Bianca es madre de familia de 23 años de edad, vive con su hija y su mamá, tiene casa propia  con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande y a una hora del departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Bianca se dedica a la preparación y venta de parrilladas y salchipollo (comida a base hot dog, papas fritas y pollo frito), negocio que lo tiene en su domicilio, atiende sábado, domingo y lunes, ya que esos día es donde más demanda tiene su producto y cuenta con su propio carrito sanguchero para la preparación del salchipollo.  Otra actividad a la que se dedica es a la crianza y venta de aves de corral.  En ambas labores que realiza tiene ingresos económcos que le permite solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla  para comprar insumos para preparar su salchipollo, parrillada e implementar infraestructura en el negocio (mesas y sillas), al implementar su negocio con material nuevo, le va a permitir brindar a su clientela un mejor servicio, por lo mismo podrá cobrar un mejor precio y así sus ganacias se incrementarán para tener un mejor nivel de vida para ella  y su familia.   Bianca es muy conocida en el lugar donde vive por la buena atención y el servicio  que brinda a sus clientes, es una persona alegre y muy trabajadora, siempre con las ganas de seguir superandose y brindarle otras oportunidades a su única hija.
texts.en:
Bianca is a 23 year old mother who lives with her daughter and her mother. They live in their own home which comes with electicity. It is located in the district of Tambogrande, one hour from the department of Piura. This area is known for its agriculture, cattle and traditional handicrafts.

Bianca prepares and sells barbequed meats, hot dogs, chips and fried chicken from her home on Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays, since these are the days when there is more demand for her products. She has her own portable cart which she uses to prepare her meals. Bianca also raises and sells poultry. Both of these jobs afford her an income that allows her to cover her living costs.

Bianca has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa through Capital Semilla to purchase ingredients to prepare her meals and buy furniture such as chairs and tables for her business. This will allow her to offer her customers a better quality of service and increase her prices so that with more income she can create a better life for herself and her family. 

Bianca is very well known in this community for the attention and service she offers her customers. She is a happy and hardworking person who is always looking to improve herself and offer her only daughter more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and furniture to set up her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMIGOS DEL MILENIO”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac; en la provincia D. Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 53 años D. edad y La socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención y dirección D. su tienda D. abarrotes, la socia desea poder implementar su tienda D. abarrotes, ella quiere comprar los productos básicos y el pago D. las otras mercaderías, ella comprara fideos al por mayor, azúcar dos bolsas grandes, arroz tres bolsas, aceite en galón. La socia quiere poder seguir teniendo los productos en su tienda para que los clientes se sientan bien servidos. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería y abastecer su tienda D. abarrotes.

Los socios se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores; a la atención  D. internet, contadora,  hay socios docentes, y una gran parte D. socias que se dedican a la venta D. comidas caseras.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y D. este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "Amigos del Milenio". She lives in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. 

The client is 53, married and has 3 children. She alternates between her activities at home and taking care of her grocery store. She wants to be able to stock her store by purchasing basic products and paying for other merchandise. She will buy noodles in bulk, sugar in large bags, three bags of rice and gallons of oil. She wants to be able to continue having products in her store so her customers feel well-served. She needs the loan to be able to buy merchandise and stock her grocery store.

The other members of the bank raise small animals, proviD. internet or accounting services, are teachers, and a large number sell homemaD. food.

The loan recipient values and is infinitely grateful for the loan that they gave her, and through this she will be able to improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments in the time stipulated.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Teodelinda

texts.es:
Teodelinda D. 55 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo, hija y nieta, que cuenta con todos los servicios, está ubicada en la parte urbana del distrito D. Chepén, el cual se encuentra a dos horas del departamento D. la Libertad y a una hora D. Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza por ser una zona agrícola y turismo

Teodelinda se dedica  a la venta D. verduras en un puesto en el mercado del distrito donD. vive, lo realiza  por las calles del distrito en donD. vive. Los productos que ofrece estan en muy buen estado (maduros y limpios) por eso las personas D. esta zona le compran por la confianza  que brinda sus productos y es una manera D. cubrir sus  necesidades diarias. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa fue D. 1000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar más verduras y otros alimentos para que ofertarlos  a sus clientes y así pueda tener más ingresos  y poder solventar sus gastos y necesidades D. su casa.  Teodelinda es una mujer responsable y trabajadora que lo que más desea es poder tener un negocio granD. donD. pueda ofrecer todo tipo D. productos para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teodelinda, 55, lives in her own home with her husband, daughter and granddaughter. Their house, which has all of the basic services, is located in the urban part of the district of Chepén, which is two hours from the department of La Libertad and one hour from Chiclayo. This district is known for agriculture and tourism.

Teodelinda sells vegetables at a stall in the district market, and also in the streets of the district where she lives. The products that she offers are in good condition (ripe and clean) and that's why people in this zone buy from her - the trust that they have in her products. In this way she covers her daily needs.

The loan that she requested from Edpyme Alternativa was for 1000 nuevo soles, which she is going to use to buy more vegetables and other food to offer her customers and thereby have more income and cover the costs and needs of her home. Teodelinda is a responsible and hardworking woman who wants to be able to have a big business where she can offer all kinds of products to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of vegetables and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 63 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Felicita es el tejido artesanal, el cual viene realizando desde que tenia 10 años, cuando ayudaba a sus padres a terminar los pedidos que tenían. Ahora ella tiene su propio taller de tejidos, el cual esta ubicado en su casa, en el distrito de Villa el Salvador, en donde atiende con mucha alegría a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre las prendas que mejor les quedaran. Lleva 15 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que tiene que cuidarlo, aún así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas, para crecer su negocio y poner una tienda de ropa artesanal. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y respetada. Con el crédito solicitado, comprara más lana para continuar con la elaboración de tejidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Felicia, 63, is a woman who has worked hard during her life.  She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to have a peaceful old age.  Since she was 10 years old she has done creative knitting.  She started  knitting to help her parents finish their orders.  Now she has her own knitting workshop located in her house in the Villa el Salvador area where she cheerfully takes care of her customers. 

 What she most likes about her work is chatting with the customers and advising them about which articles look the best on them.  She has done this work for the last 15 years and what she finds the most difficult is staying in the workshop all day to sell.  She knows that she has to work very hard to achieve her goals-for her business to grow and to have a specialty clothing shop.  This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She plans to make her payments on time since she doesn't want to jeopardize the position of the other members of the communal bank where she is very respected and liked.  She will use the loan to buy more wool to continue producing the knitwear orders that she has.

loans.use: To buy more wool

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica tiene 28 años vive en la zona de Pasankeri central en la casa de sus padres, de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con un negocio de tienda de barrio con 2 años de experiencia en el rubro.
La cliente con el transcurso del tiempo ahorró dinero de donde con ese pequeño ahorro abrió la tienda de barrio.
El destino del crédito esta destinado a capital de operación, compra de mercadería, con el dinero solicitado incrementará su mercadería para surtir su tienda.
La cliente no tiene deudas en el sistema financiero, en cuanto a su experiencia quiere ampliar su negocio y su nivel de ingresos, cuenta con actitud de pago y emprendimiento en la administración de su negocio de tienda de productos alimenticios
texts.en:
Veronica is 28 years old and lives in the area of central Pansankeri in the city of La Paz in her parent's home. She has a neighborhood store and has two years of experience in this field. 
With the small savings that she saved over time she opened her neighborhood store. 
The loan is intended for working capital to purchase merchandise. With the loan requested she will increase her merchandise to stock her store. 
Veronica does not have debts in the financial system. With her experience she wants to expand her business and her level of income. She counts on her promptness in making payments and in her entrepreneurship in managing her grocery store business.

loans.use: as working capital for her store.

loans.name: Faizan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "FAIZAN" porque es el nombre D. un ave hermosa. Esta ubicado en el estado D. Toluca, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. L. señora Rosa Maria P. es L. presidenta del grupo. ElL. Tiene 42 años, estudio hasta el tercer año D. secundaria, es cocinera, se dedica a L. venta D. comida que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en materia prima, trastes y parrilas. Al solicitar el prestamo se siente muy contenta ya que lo quiere para invertir en insumos y una parrilL. para así hacer crecer su negocio y hacer mayor cantidad D. comida para dar a basto los pedidos que le hacen diariamente. Tambien desea con las ganancias que obtenga ahorrar para brindarles educación a sus hijos y así tengan un mejor futuro y una calidad D. vida.
texts.en: This group is named "Faizan" because it is the name of a beautiful bird. It is located in the state of Toluca in Mexico. The group is maD. up of nine members. Ms. Rosa Maria P. is the president of the group. She is 42 years old and finished her third year of middle school. She is a cook and has been selling food for two years. She is requesting this loan to invest in supplies, dishes and grills. She is very happy to be requesting this loan since she wants to invest it in supplies and a grill to grow her business and to be able to make greater quantities of food to fill the orders she gets daily. With her profits she also wants to save to be able to proviD. her children with an education so that they an have a better future and better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in supplies and a grill for her food business.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 2 hijos, la cual cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en  9 de Octubre que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican al comercio y a manejar transporte publico (taxi y mototaxi).

Pilar  se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco al por menor para el consumo de las personas y los vende en el mercado de 9 de octubre en su propiopuesto que tiene, este trabajo lo realiza todos los días por las mañanas desde muy temprano, con la finalidad de tener todo listo una vez que abren el mercado y así podrá atender a su clientela sin demorá, para que al final de de su jornada tenga los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2800 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar de una computadora para que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor desarrollo académico, ya que les va ayudar a resolver sus tareas del colegio. Toda la dedicación a su trabajo lo hace por el simple hechoque sus hijos puedan tener lo ella no pudo y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida que es lo que toda madre desea para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a 39-year-old mother who lives in her parents' home with her two children. Their home, which has all the basic services, is located in 9 de Octubre which is in the province of Chiclayo. The people in this district are merchants and public transportation workers (taxi and mototaxi). 

Pilar buys and sells fresh fish for personal consumption. She sells them in the market in 9 de Octubre in the stall that she has. She works every day beginning early in the morning, with the goal of having everything ready when the market opens so that she can attend to her customers without delay. That way by the end of her shift she will have the money she needs to cover her family's obligations.

The loan that she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 2800 nuevos soles and she will use it to buy a computer so that her children can better their academic development. The computer will help them to complete their high school assignments. All of the dedication that she puts into her work is for the simple goal that her children can have what she couldn't and that they can have a better quality of life, which is what every mother wants for her kids.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children's studies.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis tiene 32 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. En estos últimos años, Elvis se ha dedicado a vender sus productos de limpieza recorriendo las calles del distrito de Villa el Salvador. El poder de convencimiento que posee junto a su carisma y buen humor, han hecho de él un vendedor muy hábil y ahora cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes estables, que siempre lo buscan para comprarle los productos que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años vendiendo este tipo de productos y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar por la calles en busca de clientes, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que hacerlo, anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos de limpieza con mayor tranquilidad. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de limpieza, para ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor oferta.
texts.en: Elvis is a very friendly and hard-working 32-year-old man. He lives in a rented home and is willing to work very hard to move up in life. In the past few years, Elvis has been making a living selling cleaning supplies in the streets of the district of Villa El Salvador. His power of persuasion along with his charisma and good humor have made him a very skilled salesman, and now he has a large number of regular customers who always seek him out to buy the products he sells. What he enjoys most about his job is conversing with his customers. He has two years of experience selling these types of products, and he thinks the most difficult thing is having to walk the streets in search of customers, but he knows that's part of his job and he has to do it. His goal is to have a store where he can sell his cleaning products with more tranquility. This is his eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that he has to repay it on time because he doesn't want to cause problems for the members of his community bank, where he is a valued member. With the loan he is requesting, Elvis plans to purchase more cleaning products so he can offer his customers a wider selection.

loans.use: to purchase more cleaning products

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 29 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jhon de 28 años y su querida hija Nicol de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Visitando a sus clientes en sus mismas casas, Luz realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con la venta de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En su barrio es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedara a su piel. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar por la venta de sus productos ya que algunos clientes no le pagan a tiempo. En  adelante, espera poner su tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender mas cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más cosméticos, ya que está teniendo mucha demanda.
texts.en: Luz is a very friendly and hard-working 29-year-old woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Jhon, 28, and their beloved daughter Nicol, 4, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Luz sells beauty products, visiting her customers in their homes. She is a very persistent and persuasive saleswoman who is motivated to sell her cosmetics quickly. She is very well-known in her neighborhood, and they know the products she sells are of very high quality. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her clients on what best fits their skin. She has two years of experience and the thing she considers to be the most difficult is charging for the products since some customers don't pay on time. In the future, she hopes to have a cosmetics store where she can sell in more comfort and not have to go from house to house. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She wants to make her business grow, and she plans to make her payments on time so she can have access to more loans. Furthermore, she counts on the support of her community bank. She is requesting the loan to purchase more cosmetics because they are in very high demand.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Oscar le esta haciendo falta terminar la paredes de dos cuartos que esta construyendo. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento y arena, ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Don Oscar trabaja para una compañía de construcción de casa como ayudante de construcción este ingreso con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Elena se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo. 
Desean que sus tres hijos que tiene tengan su propio espacio y privacidad en su casa, para que puedan realizar las tareas de la escuela sin que los molesten.
texts.en: The home Oscar is building is missing walls on two of the rooms. He is requesting the loan to be able to purchase materials like cements and sand, since he is in charge of making the improvements in addition to his job. Oscar works for a home-building company as a construction assistant, and he plans to repay the loan with this income since his wife, Maria Elena, is in charge of the family expenses with the salary she makes from her job. They hope that their three children can have their own space and privacy in the home so they can do their schoolwork without being bothered.

loans.use: to finish construction on two rooms.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her family. She is engaged in farming. She tills her land properly for growing rice and corn crops. Florentina sells her harvest at her town's market.

Florentina's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest with her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 26 bags of different types of groundnuts.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She primarily grows corn crops, then sells her harvest at the market. Gemma also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market as well. Gemma works hard to provide for the needs of her family.

Gemma plans to use her loan to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and married. She has two children, aged 2 and 3. She is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Grace tills her land, where she grows rice and corn crops. Grace does her best to improve her earnings and provide for the needs of her household.

Grace's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes for his business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She said that she is able to feed her family through her farm. She grows rice and corn crops, then sells her harvest at the market. She does her best to ensure quality produce from her farm.

Herminia joined CEVI to gain financial assistance. She applied for a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she will use to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This is Herminia's first loan and she hopes for it to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

Herminia is 59 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her youngest child still goes to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy, age 44, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in a business of raising pigs to resell, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a local doctor earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Savy and her husband have had these businesses. Savy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to build pig cages to raise more pigs. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to build more pig cages to raise pigs.

loans.name: Sagom

texts.en: Sagom, age 48, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of raising pigs to resell, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who produces wooden furniture and earns an income of $8 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sagom and her husband have had these businesses. Sagom is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase pig food and wood to expand her husband’s and her businesses. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pig food and wood to improve the businesses.

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en:
Jeni is a 32-year-old lady who married to Messakh, 29 years old. They have a cute son named Jetriks, who is one year old. They live with Jeni’s parents. Jeni and husband work as farmers in order to meet their daily needs.

Jeni is a hard worker; she has been a farmer for almost five years and plants vegetables such as mustard greens, “kangkung” and chilies.  She gets up early in the morning, goes to the farm and returns home when the sun goes down. Every morning she prepares vegetables and brings them in sacks to the market using a motorbike. Jeni has customers who are willing to buy vegetables from her wholesale, and her customers resell the vegetables in the market. In the evening, she looks after her baby while doing her tasks as a housewife. 

Jeni is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) from Kiva field partner TLM, and plans to use the loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and chicks. She dreams of opening other businesses in order to generate more income for her family; one undertaking she wants to start is a chicken broiler business.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and chicks

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Salamatu, a married mother of four children aged 3, 6, 9 and 12 years. In 2007, Salamatu established her lubricant business as a means of sustaining herself and family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business.

Salamatu is requesting a loan in the amount of Le 3,500,000 in order to buy more lubricants by the drum for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 150,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to support her children and construct a dwelling for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for lubricants by the drum.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school.  

Susan is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  She raises pigs and has been in this busines for 5 years now.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  This is her second loan from NWTF.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tak

texts.en: Tak, age 55, is married and resides with her 2 children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of raising pigs to resell, earning an income of 3 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a local police officer, earning an income of 4 USD per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Tak and her husband have had these jobs. Tak is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to pay for the administration fee for one of her children to work in South Korea. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the administration fee for the children to work in South Korea

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has three children ages 6, 9 and 12 years. 

In 1996, Rugiatu established her cooking utensils business. She began her business in order to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 950,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid a loan when she was selling used clothing , and now she requires a new loan in order to buy cooking utensils for her business as she has decided to changes her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future Rugiatu plans to buy land where she will build a house. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 32-year-old widow with 2 children.  With her 2 children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.   She runs a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as rice, softdrinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.   She has been in this business for 7 years.  

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries for her store to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 42 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Susana has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman with four children. One child is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rufina is 55 years old.

Rufina has a fish farming business in the Philippines. Rufina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and fingerlings for her fish farming business.

Rufina has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Rufina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and fingerlings for her fish pond business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 58 years old and a widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonila has a general store business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount NWTF to purchase more stock of goods to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her dressmaking business.

Juliana has been in this business for 25 years. Juliana earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 60 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maura is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Maura has been raising pigs for eight years and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 51 years old and has a child who is in school.

Editha has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tailoring supplies and a new motorbike.

loans.name: Sillah

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Sillah. He is married and has three children, ages 8, 5 and 8 months. 

In 2003, Sillah established his auto spare parts business. He began his business because he noticed high demand for spare part and believed such business could help him become self-reliant. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 750,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Sillah requires the loan in order to buy additional spare parts and engine oil. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Sillah plans to get a dwelling house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy auto spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Ana Liza

texts.en:
Ana Liza is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Ana Liza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry.

Ana Liza has been raising poultry for eight years and earns additional income from selling gasoline and fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Clarissa

texts.en:
Ma. Clarissa is 23 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Clarissa has a business buying and selling RTW (clothing) products in the Philippines. Ma. Clarissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Clarissa has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Ma. Clarissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, age 52, is married and resides with his two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia. 

He and his wife are engaged in a business of selling groceries. They earn an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since Phat and his wife have had this business. 

Phat is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. Phat appears in the photograph with his family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy, age 48, is married and resides with his four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia. 

He is engaged in a business as a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. His standard of living has been improved since Vuthy has had this business. 

Vuthy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to attach to his motorbike to sell fried noodles. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike to sell fried noodles.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 44 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pilar has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Pilar requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat to sell.

Pilar has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Pilar would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy local goods like palm oil and groundnuts in large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Exuperia

texts.en:
Exuperia is married with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Exuperia is 49 years old.

Exuperia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Exuperia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional coolers and fish to sell in her food stall.

Exuperia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Exuperia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional coolers and fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 59 years old and married with six children.

Antonieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonieta has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 38 years old and has two children who are in school. Carmela is married.

Carmela is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Carmela requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

Carmela has been farming vegetable for seven years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a meat vending/frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy meat to sell and to pay laborers' salaries.

Vilma has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell and to pay laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Chalita

texts.en:
Chalita is a married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Chalita is 50 years old.

Chalita has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Chalita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Chalita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Chalita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Florefe

texts.en:
Florefe works hard to support her family. Florefe is married and has a Sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Florefe requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, groceries, etc,. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Florefe has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Florefe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like bread, groceries, etc,. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jenaline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jenaline works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Jenaline is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy stock of frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Jenaline has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in a house in Selenge province, Mongolia. His older son is a businessman who supplies used tires to the Russian market. 

Ganbold manages an animal hides trading business in his town. He started his business in 1994 and has gained much experience. He collects animal hides such as sheep and goat skin from herders and sells them to wholesale traders. 

During the recent economic recession, Ganbold's business went into a stagnant period and he had difficulty overcoming the obstacles. However, his excellent managerial skill helped him to improve and develop his business further. 

He is a responsible man who attributes his business success to his good accounting skill. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw hides in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more raw hides.

loans.name: Gurbadam

texts.en:
Gurbadam is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter attends a kindergarten and his son stays at home in his wife’s care. 

Gurbadam runs a transportation business. Four years ago he bought a truck and started delivering his clients' goods from warehouses to market. He is a very good auto mechanic and handyman. In his spare time, he fixes other people's cars in his garage. Since he started his business his family’s living condition is improving. They have bought a family house recently. 

Gurbadam is planning to buy a building block-making machine and to start producing building blocks. This is a small machine that uses cement and sand mix and produces 20 blocks in an hour. People use these blocks for building houses, fences and other structures.

The loan Gurbadam is requesting will be used to buy a block-making press machine and start producing building blocks.

loans.use: To buy a block-making press machine and start producing cement blocks that people use to build houses and fences.

loans.name: Beinvinida

texts.en:
Beinvinida is married with six, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beinvinida is 44 years old.

Beinvinida has a fish-selling business in the Philippines. Beinvinida requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Beinvinida has been in this business for five years. In the future, Beinvinida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
Paciencia is 46 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Paciencia has a shell crafting business in the Philippines. Paciencia requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafting business .

Paciencia has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Paciencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafting business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg is a 28-year-old widow who lives with her two children in a house in Hentii province, Mongolia. Her older son goes to a local secondary school while younger one is in kindergarten. 

She manages a meat-trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2009 and is planning to continue it in the future. Now her daily business earning is 60,000 - 110,000 MNT. She has managed to build a strong customer base and has become a very experienced businesswoman. 

In addition to her meat-trading business, she also operates a transportation service in order to supplement her earnings. 

She is an honest and hardworking lady who says, "My business is the only income for my family. So I will work hard to expand my business in the future." 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase many sheep for her meat-trading business.

loans.use: To purchase many sheep.

loans.name: Veoun

texts.en:
Veoun, age 63, is married and resides with his wife and child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. 

He is engaged in a business as a motorbike repairman, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since Veoun has had this business. 

Veoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase motorbike spare parts to resell and improve his business. This is his third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts to resell and improve the business.

loans.name: Oktyabri

texts.en:
Oktyabri is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two infants in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent, in someone else's backyard. They live in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife takes care of their infants and stays home. 

He manages a animal hides trading business in his town. He started his business in 2010. Previously, he used to work as a constructor and then he began conducting a taxi business. Therefore, he is quite an experienced businessman who is planning to continue his animal hides trading business in the future. 

He is a friendly man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skill. He is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of animal hides.

loans.name: Yamakoro

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Yamakoro.  She is married and has two children aged 6 and 10 years. In 2006, Yamakoro established her imported food and cosmetics business. 

She began her business because she wanted to provide for her family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to buy 50 cartons of tomato paste @Le55,000, 20 cartons of polish @Le 50,000 and five cartons of Vaseline @Le100,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.

 In the future, Yamakoro plans to educate her children fully, construct a house and send her children to the United States. She is very determined and hardworking.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food, imported items and cosmetics

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old and has a common-law husband with one child.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock for her general store.

Gemma has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns an income from farming rice and corn.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is a widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines.
