Helen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Helen has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Ms.Otgonjargal is a 27-year-old, single woman. She lives with her son in a one-bedroom apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is 4 years old. Otganjargal’s parents look after her son, giving Otgonjargal a chance to work and earn money. She has a boyfriend who works in Korea at the moment.

Otgonjargal worked at a factory in South Korea on a labor exchange contract for three years. When she came back from Korea, she started running a clothing retail business. She rents a stall at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. 

She buys her products from wholesalers who import them from abroad. The rent price for the stall is quite high and its costly for her business. Therefore she decided to buy a stall at the Narantuul market, making an investment in her business. The loan she is taking will be used to buy a permanent stall at the market and to sell her products to clients.

loans.use: to buy a permanent stall at the market and to use it for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Esperanza works hard to support her family.

She has a food production sales business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from sari-sari (variety) store.  Esperanza is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Esperanza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and batteries for his business

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 64-year-old farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. He tills his own land and prepares it well for crops. Jose grows rice and corn crops on his land. He works hard to provide for his family's needs.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Jose hopes this loan will help improve his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, age 44, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has four children. 

She is engaged in a business as a grocery seller, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. The standard of living has been improved since Chanthorn and her husband have had these businesses. 

Chanthorn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek is 32 years old and lives in the village of Tukadaya with her husband and two children, who are still toddlers. She works as a coconut picker along with her husband, and she is pursuing efforts to establish a pig farm to bring in additional family income.
Ni Kadek is chairman of her loan group, Sombang Lestari. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, MUK, for 1,200,000 IDR, which she will use to buy three piglets for fattening plus pig feed. The pigs will be maintained for five months.
This loan is her third from MUK. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR. She is requesting an increased loan for her growing piglets. Looking to the future, Ni Kadek hope that her pigs can be kept healthy. She hopes to get a bigger profit that she can use as additional capital and also to meet everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy three piglets for fattening and pig feed.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen, age 64, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in a business as a traditional cake seller, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who produces cement jars, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Pen and her husband have had these businesses. Pen is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Oyungerel is 50 years old and lives with her husband in a ger—a Mongolian yurt—in Hovd Province, Mongolia. All her grown-up children live and work on their own. She manages a shoemaking business in her town. She started her business in 1993 after working at a private company for 14 years. Now she makes a variety of Mongolian traditional shoes, which she sells large amounts of during holidays. She is a polite woman who is planning to purchase a new sewing machine in order to improve her business. She says, "I want to improve my business, because it is the only source of income for us." She is requesting a loan of 800,000 Mongolian tögrögs (MNT) to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, age 50, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business producing brooms and baskets, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a farmer earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Nary and her husband have had these businesses. Nary is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase cows to raise for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise and sell
